original: @1b # // sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @1b # // sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Tara!

original: gang zhig sdig pa can gyi skye bo slu bar byed pa rnams ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po sna tshogs pa 'di dag shing thog dang rdo dang tsher ma'i rno ba la sogs pa ltar rgyu med pa nyid dam mthong ba'i rgyu can nam ma mthong
analyzed: gang zhig sdig pa can gyi skye bo slu bar byed pa rnams ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po sna tshogs pa 'di dag shing thog dang rdo dang tsher ma'i rno ba la sogs pa ltar rgyu med pa nyid dam mthong ba'i rgyu can nam ma mthong
translated: Those who deceive sinful people think that these various internal and external things, like the sweetness of fruit, the hardness of a stone, the sharpness of a thorn, etc., are without cause, or that they have a cause which is not seen, or that they have a cause which is seen.

original: ba'i rgyu can yin na yang blo sngon du btang ba yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: ba'i rgyu can yin na yang blo sngon du btang ba yin no snyam ste /
translated: But they are preceded by the mind.

original: de'i phyir yang sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
translated: Therefore, he asks in detail, What is the sentient and inanimate world?

original: rgyu sna tshogs pa'i phyir shing thog dang rdo ba la sogs pa rnams ni sna tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu sna tshogs pa'i phyir shing thog dang rdo ba la sogs pa rnams ni sna tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: Because of the variety of causes, fruit, stones, etc., are various.

original: rgyu med pa ni ma yin te shing gcig las skyes pa'i shing thog rnams la yang rgyu dang rkyen sna tshogs pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni ma yin te shing gcig las skyes pa'i shing thog rnams la yang rgyu dang rkyen sna tshogs pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: They are not without cause, for even the fruit of a single tree has various causes and conditions,

original: me tog la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the flowers, etc., are different.

original: shing tog dang rdo ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: shing tog dang rdo ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If fruits, stones, etc. were without a cause,

original: thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: everything would arise without a cause.

original: de'i rgyu khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa mthong ba kho na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa mthong ba kho na yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that the cause of a sprout, such as seed, water, soil, etc., is not seen.

original: khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa khyad par med bzhin @2a * //
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa khyad par med bzhin @2a * //
translated: Even though there is no difference in the seed, water, etc.,

original: du yang bong tshad dang gzugs dang dbang po tshang ba dang ma tshang ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du yang bong tshad dang gzugs dang dbang po tshang ba dang ma tshang ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: a sprout is seen to have a certain size, shape, and complete or incomplete sense faculties.

original: bya ba dag la mnyam por 'jug pa na kha cig gis bya ba'i 'bras bu thob la /
analyzed: bya ba dag la mnyam por 'jug pa na kha cig gis bya ba'i 'bras bu thob la /
translated: When engaged in the same action, some obtain the result of the action,

original: kha cig ni ngal ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur na de ni ma mthong ba'i rgyu med par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig ni ngal ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur na de ni ma mthong ba'i rgyu med par mi rung ngo //
translated: while others only experience fatigue. That is not possible without a cause.

original: 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du btang nas byas pa yang ma yin te de ni bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du btang nas byas pa yang ma yin te de ni bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not that some act with prior intention, because that has been refuted.

original: de la sems can gyi 'jig rten sna tshogs ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang tshad dang tshe la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bshad do //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi 'jig rten sna tshogs ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang tshad dang tshe la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bshad do //
translated: The diversity of the world of sentient beings is explained in terms of the various realms, life-forms, birth processes, sizes, lifespans, etc.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs pa ni gzhal med khang dang / gling dang ri dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bshad do //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs pa ni gzhal med khang dang / gling dang ri dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bshad do //
translated: The diversity of the world of the physical environment is explained in terms of the various palaces, continents, mountains, wind-mounds, etc.

original: sus kyang blo sngon du btang ste byas pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni sprul pa pos sprul pa ltar ro //
analyzed: sus kyang blo sngon du btang ste byas pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni sprul pa pos sprul pa ltar ro //
translated: No one has created it by prior planning, as in the case of a magician creating an illusion.

original: gal te rgyu med pa'am mthong ba'i rgyu can nam /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa'am mthong ba'i rgyu can nam /
translated: If it is not causeless, or if it is not created by a cause that is perceptible,

original: blo sngon du btang ste ma yin na de'i phyir 'o na ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: blo sngon du btang ste ma yin na de'i phyir 'o na ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: or if it is not created by prior planning, then how is it created?

original: sems can rnams kyi las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that the diversity of the world arises from the karma of sentient beings.

original: gang ci rigs par 'bras bu bzhi'i sgo nas las kyi 'bras bu @2b ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi skye ba de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ci rigs par 'bras bu bzhi'i sgo nas las kyi 'bras bu @2b ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi skye ba de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other arising of any thing whatsoever that is not the result of karma, in any way whatsoever, in any of the four ways.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las rnams kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi skye ba de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las rnams kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi skye ba de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other arising of any thing whatsoever that is not the result of karma.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las rnams kyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnams kyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of karma is seen.

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba bskyed pa la las rnams kyi nus pa mngon sum nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba bskyed pa la las rnams kyi nus pa mngon sum nyid du snang ste /
translated: The power of karma to produce pleasant and unpleasant results is directly evident.

original: dper na zhing pa'i 'bad pa las zhing rmo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / gzhan gyi chung ma la 'gro ba las 'bras bu mi 'dod pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na zhing pa'i 'bad pa las zhing rmo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / gzhan gyi chung ma la 'gro ba las 'bras bu mi 'dod pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, the result of the effort of farmers, such as plowing fields, is the production of crops. The result of going to another‚Äôs wife is the production of unwanted results.

original: kha cig ni 'bad pa med par mngal nas 'thon pa bkrus pa man chad du bde bar mthong la /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bad pa med par mngal nas 'thon pa bkrus pa man chad du bde bar mthong la /
translated: Some are seen to emerge from the womb without effort, and are happy from the time of birth, being bathed and so on.

original: kha cig ni sdug par mthong ngo //
analyzed: kha cig ni sdug par mthong ngo //
translated: Some see it as pleasant.

original: 'dir 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba thob pa ni las sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba thob pa ni las sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas /
translated: Here, the attainment of a pleasant or unpleasant result is preceded by karma.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal thob pa de yang sngon du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal thob pa de yang sngon du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the attainment of pleasure and pain is also preceded by karma.

original: gang dag rma lta bur gyur pa'i lus dag dang / de'i yul du gyur pa'i longs spyod dga' dga' lta bu dag 'byung ba las de dag ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag rma lta bur gyur pa'i lus dag dang / de'i yul du gyur pa'i longs spyod dga' dga' lta bu dag 'byung ba las de dag ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can dag yin no //
translated: The bodies that are like wounds and the enjoyments that are like objects of desire arise from karma.

original: yang las de dag gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang las de dag gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: Now, whose are these karmas?

original: de'i phyir sems can 'dren mar byed pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can 'dren mar byed pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúof sentient beings who act erratically.‚Äù

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means of those who act virtuously and non-virtuously.

original: de ltar na las gnyi ga na 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na las gnyi ga na 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, both karmas have results, but not others.

original: 'di ltar lus dga' dga' lta bu dag gis yul dga' dga' lta bu ma yin pa longs spyod pa ni mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus dga' dga' lta bu dag gis yul dga' dga' lta bu ma yin pa longs spyod pa ni mi nus so //
translated: Thus, a body that is not delightful cannot enjoy a delightful object.

original: de la rag las te 'jug pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / de las gzhan pa'i khyad par med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rag las te 'jug pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / de las gzhan pa'i khyad par med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not function in dependence on that, and because there is no difference from that.

original: de'i phyir las de lta bu dag kho nas zhes bya ba 'di rigs te skyed par byed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir las de lta bu dag kho nas zhes bya ba 'di rigs te skyed par byed pa yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that only those actions that are productive are the cause of the body.

original: gzhan dag na re /üîΩthun mong @3a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / thun mong @3a * //
translated: Others say:

original: ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is the result of common action.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis ni padma dang au tu lu la sogs pa skye la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis ni padma dang au tu lu la sogs pa skye la /
translated: Lotus, sugarcane, and so on arise through the power of the virtuous actions of all sentient beings.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis ni dug dang tsher ma la sogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis ni dug dang tsher ma la sogs pa skye'o //
translated: Poison, thorns, and so on arise through the power of nonvirtuous actions.

original: so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi las kyi 'bras bu dag ni sems can gyi lus rnams yin la /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi las kyi 'bras bu dag ni sems can gyi lus rnams yin la /
translated: The bodies of sentient beings are the results of the individual actions of sentient beings.

original: de dag kyang sems pa 'dren mas skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems pa 'dren mas skyed par byed do //
translated: And those are produced by the productive cause.

original: de dag la yod pa'i ni ma yin te padma dang au tu la la sogs pa ni thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la yod pa'i ni ma yin te padma dang au tu la la sogs pa ni thun mong ba'o //
translated: But they are not the basis of the latter, because the lotus, the udumbara flower, etc. are common to both.

original: 'di ltar sems pa de sa gang gis phyir la 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa rnams kyi lus dang longs spyod dga' dga' lta bu dag skyes /üîΩde ni sems pa dang des byas zhes bya bas ni las thams cad mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems pa de sa gang gis phyir la 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa rnams kyi lus dang longs spyod dga' dga' lta bu dag skyes / de ni sems pa dang des byas zhes bya bas ni las thams cad mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the body and the possessions of those who are not led by the mind are born as if they were unpleasant.üîΩThe author now summarizes all action in two categories:

original: sems pa dang zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: sems pa dang zhes bya ba na /
translated: volitional action and action consequent upon that volition.üîΩVolitional action is that which is done by the body, speech, or mind after deliberation.

original: 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig tu bya'o snyam du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig tu bya'o snyam du'o //
translated: It is action that is done after deliberation.

original: mdo las / bsams par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir bstan bcos las sems par byas pa zhes bshad de ;üîΩsems pas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdo las / bsams par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir bstan bcos las sems par byas pa zhes bshad de ; sems pas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the sutras, it is called volition, but in the treatise it is called volitional action.üîΩThe meaning of the two terms is the same.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni sems pas byas pa'i las la rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni sems pas byas pa'i las la rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The author now explains the three kinds of action.

original: thams cad lus la brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: thams cad lus la brten pa'i phyir //
translated: All action is based on the body,

original: zhes bya ba ni lus la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it occurs in dependence on the body.

original: de ltar na lus la brten pa'i lus kyi las yin pas ngag dang yid kyi las kyang lus kyi las nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩdag gi las gcig pur 'gyur ba ni dag gi rang bzhin gyi las so zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lus la brten pa'i lus kyi las yin pas ngag dang yid kyi las kyang lus kyi las nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro // dag gi las gcig pur 'gyur ba ni dag gi rang bzhin gyi las so zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it follows that speech and mental actions would be bodily actions, because they are actions of the body, in dependence on the body.üîΩBut this is unacceptable, because it is established that only that which is of the nature of speech is a speech action, and only that which is of the nature of mind is a mental action.

original: lus dang yid kyi las gnyis ni de ltar las dang yid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas de gnyis las nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lus dang yid kyi las gnyis ni de ltar las dang yid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas de gnyis las nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: The two actions of body and mind are not actions in the same way that speech is, because they are not of the nature of speech.

original: gal te kun nas slong ba las yin na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te kun nas slong ba las yin na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say that action is that which motivates,

original: yid kyi las de bzhin du lus dang ngag gi las @3b gnyis kyang yid kyis rab tu bcug pa'i phyir yid yin pa nyid pas yid kyi las gcig pur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi las de bzhin du lus dang ngag gi las @3b gnyis kyang yid kyis rab tu bcug pa'i phyir yid yin pa nyid pas yid kyi las gcig pur 'gyur ro //
translated: then the two actions of body and speech would be mental actions, because they are engaged by the mind, just like mental action.üîΩThe three causes are the three roots of nonvirtue,üîΩand the three results are the three results of nonvirtue.üîΩThe three causes are the three roots of virtue,

original: rgyu gsum gyis go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la lus kyi las yin te /üîΩde ni yid kyis kun nas bslangs pa nyid yin yang lus la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la lus kyi las yin te /üîΩde ni yid kyis kun nas bslangs pa nyid yin yang lus la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the three results are the three results of virtue.

original: ngag gi las ni ngo bo nyid las yin te /
analyzed: ngag gi las ni ngo bo nyid las yin te /
translated: The verbal action is from the nature itself,

original: de ni ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of speech.

original: yid kyi las ni kun nas slong ba las yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi las ni kun nas slong ba las yin te /
translated: The mental action is from the instigation,

original: de ni yid kyi kun nas bslang ba'i phyir dang de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi kun nas bslang ba'i phyir dang de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is instigated by the mind and is based on it.

original: de ltar na gsum char la yang phan tshun khyad par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gsum char la yang phan tshun khyad par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the distinction of each of the three is taught.

original: sems pa yid kyi las yin no zhes yid kyi las kyi ngo bo bshad kyi /
analyzed: sems pa yid kyi las yin no zhes yid kyi las kyi ngo bo bshad kyi /
translated: The nature of the mental action is explained as volition,

original: lus dang ngag gi las dag gi ni ma yin pas /üîΩde'i phyir / de dag rnam rig rnam rig min ;
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dag gi ni ma yin pas / de'i phyir / de dag rnam rig rnam rig min ;
translated: but not the nature of the bodily and verbal actions.üîΩTherefore, he says:

original: / zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Those are perception and non-perception.

original: de skad du mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du mdo las /
translated: Thus, it is said in a Sutra:

original: lus kyi las gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi las gang zhe na /
translated: What is bodily action?

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is the intimation and non-intimation of the body.

original: ngag gi las gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngag gi las gang zhe na /
translated: What is verbal action?

original: ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the intimation and non-intimation of speech.

original: ni'i sgra ni de dag kho na rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag yin gyi /üîΩyid kyi las ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni de dag kho na rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag yin gyi / yid kyi las ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates that they are only informative form and non-informative form,üîΩand not mental karma.

original: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi las kyang rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi las kyang rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is mental karma not considered to be informative form and non-informative form?

original: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not have the characteristics of those two.üîΩIf you say that informative form is so called because it causes the mind to be known,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not informative.

original: rang kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed ce na /
analyzed: rang kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed ce na /
translated: If you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the mind that generates it,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not non-informative.üîΩIf you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the primary elements that generate it, and it exists separately from those primary elements,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not non-informative.üîΩIf you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the mind that generates it, and it exists separately from the mind that generates it,

original: sems la ni mtshan nyid de yod pa ma yin pas sems pas rnam par rig byed ma yin no //
analyzed: sems la ni mtshan nyid de yod pa ma yin pas sems pas rnam par rig byed ma yin no //
translated: then since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not non-informative.üîΩIf you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the primary elements that generate it, and it exists separately from the primary elements that generate it,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not non-informative.üîΩIf you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the primary elements that generate it, and it exists separately from the primary elements that generate it,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not non-informative.üîΩIf you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the primary elements that generate it, and it exists separately from the primary elements that generate it,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not non-informative.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa'i 'byung ba logs na 'byung ba gzhan la bstan nas 'jug na dge ba'i sems ni de ltar kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems logs na nyon mongs pa @4a * //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa'i 'byung ba logs na 'byung ba gzhan la bstan nas 'jug na dge ba'i sems ni de ltar kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems logs na nyon mongs pa @4a * //
translated: If you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the primary elements that generate it, and it exists separately from the primary elements that generate it,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic, it is not non-informative.üîΩIf you say that non-informative form is so called because it is generated by the primary elements that generate it, and it exists separately from the primary elements that generate it,üîΩthen since the mind does not have that characteristic,

original: can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la brten nas 'jug par mi bzod do //
analyzed: can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la brten nas 'jug par mi bzod do //

original: de'i phyir sems pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin par yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin par yang mi rigs so //

analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rlung gi dbang gis kyang lus kyi dbyibs de dang de ltar 'gyur pas /

analyzed: gzhan dag na re lus la yod pa sems las skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i 'bras bu dbyibs kyi khyad par ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed ces bya'o zhes zer ro ;

original: / yang ci'i phyir kha dog dang 'byung ba dag rnam par rig byed ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: / yang ci'i phyir kha dog dang 'byung ba dag rnam par rig byed ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: de dag ni gcig tu lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'gro ba yin zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed do //

original: de ni lus g-yo ba yin pas /
analyzed: de ni lus g-yo ba yin pas /

original: mgul pa'i lus kho na la rigs kyi /
analyzed: mgul pa'i lus kho na la rigs kyi /

original: mi g-yo ba la ni ma yin pas lus kyi rnam par rig byed 'gro ba kho na yin gyis dbyibs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la ni ma yin pas lus kyi rnam par rig byed 'gro ba kho na yin gyis dbyibs ni ma yin no //

original: de dag kyang yan lag gang gis rnam par rig par byed pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs de'i bdag nyid ni rnam par rig byed du 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang yan lag gang gis rnam par rig par byed pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs de'i bdag nyid ni rnam par rig byed du 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /

original: 'dod pa bden te /
analyzed: 'dod pa bden te /

original: de ni lus kyi yul gzhan thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba zhes brjod pa yin no //üîΩskad cig ma'i sgra don du ma'i brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba na /
analyzed: de ni lus kyi yul gzhan thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba zhes brjod pa yin no // skad cig ma'i sgra don du ma'i brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba na /
translated: But it is called movement because it is the cause of the body obtaining another place.

original: skad cig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is momentary?‚ÄùüîΩit is asked in order to determine the meaning of the term momentary.

original: 'di ltar skad cig gi sgra ni stong pa la yang 'jug pa ni snod skad cig pa zhes bya ba ste stong ngo zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig gi sgra ni stong pa la yang 'jug pa ni snod skad cig pa zhes bya ba ste stong ngo zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The term ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù is used for emptiness, as in the expression ‚Äúthe momentary destruction of the world,‚Äù and it is also used for the impermanence of compounded phenomena.

original: bya ba med pa la ni lhas byin skad cig ma zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba med pa la ni lhas byin skad cig ma zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the absence of activity, it is called ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs moment.‚Äù

original: bya ba dang bral zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: bya ba dang bral zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: It is understood to be ‚Äúfree from activity.‚Äù

original: yul la sogs pa dang bral ba la yang 'di skad cig ma gcig nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa dang bral ba la yang 'di skad cig ma gcig nyid ces bya ste /
translated: In the absence of an object, etc., it is called ‚Äújust a moment.‚Äù

original: gang zag tshangs par spyod par gnas pa ni dus gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag tshangs par spyod par gnas pa ni dus gcig ces bya'o //
translated: A person who abides in pure conduct is called ‚Äúone moment.‚Äù

original: dus kyi mtha' la ni skad cig tsam byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' la ni skad cig tsam byas zhes bya'o //
translated: The end of time is called ‚Äújust a moment.‚ÄùüîΩIn the destruction immediately after arising,

original: @4b bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @4b bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is called ‚Äúdestruction immediately after arising.‚Äù

original: 'di la bar chad med pas na red ma thag go //
analyzed: 'di la bar chad med pas na red ma thag go //
translated: Since there is no interruption here, it is ‚Äúimmediately after arising.‚Äù

original: red ma thag pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin pas na red ma thag tu 'jig ste /
analyzed: red ma thag pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin pas na red ma thag tu 'jig ste /
translated: Since it is both ‚Äúimmediately after arising‚Äù and ‚Äúdestruction,‚Äù it is ‚Äúdestruction immediately after arising.‚Äù

original: de 'di la yod pas na red ma thag tu 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na red ma thag tu 'jig pa'o //
translated: Since it exists here, it is ‚Äúdestruction immediately after arising.‚Äù

original: skyes pa'i 'og tu mi gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes pa'i 'og tu mi gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not abide after arising.

original: dus gzhan du gnas par smra ba'i ltar na bdag nyid du red pa'i 'og rol tu 'jig pa yod pas khyad par du bya ba'i phyir red ma thag tu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas par smra ba'i ltar na bdag nyid du red pa'i 'og rol tu 'jig pa yod pas khyad par du bya ba'i phyir red ma thag tu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In the system of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas who maintain that things endure for a period of time, the word ‚Äúimmediately‚Äù is used to specify that destruction occurs after the thing has endured.

original: skad cig ma'i sgras brjod par bya ba de lta bu'i rigs can bdag nyid du red pa de 'di la yod pas na 'dus byas ni skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i sgras brjod par bya ba de lta bu'i rigs can bdag nyid du red pa de 'di la yod pas na 'dus byas ni skad cig ma'o //
translated: A conditioned thing is momentary because it has the nature of being the object of the expression ‚Äúmomentary.‚Äù

original: gzhan nyid ma yin na brjod pa med do zhe na mthong ba'i phyir ma yin te dper na khyi gu'i lus bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma yin na brjod pa med do zhe na mthong ba'i phyir ma yin te dper na khyi gu'i lus bzhin no //
translated: If it were not different, it would not be momentary.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: dus thams cad kyi nang na thung ba ni snga phyi dbye bar mi nus pas 'du byed thams cad kyi thung ba'i gnas skabs de nyid 'du byed rnams kyi da ltar ba'i skad cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad kyi nang na thung ba ni snga phyi dbye bar mi nus pas 'du byed thams cad kyi thung ba'i gnas skabs de nyid 'du byed rnams kyi da ltar ba'i skad cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Among all times, the shortest is the present, which cannot be divided into earlier and later parts. The shortest period of time of all conditioned things is the present moment of those conditioned things.

original: de 'di la yod pas yongs su 'jal bas skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas yongs su 'jal bas skad cig ma ste /
translated: Since it exists in that, it is measured by that.

original: nye ba'i khyi gu bzhin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i khyi gu bzhin no //
translated: It is like a small dog.

original: de ltar bdag nyid thob pa nyid skad cig tu bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid thob pa nyid skad cig tu bshad de /
translated: Thus, it is explained that the attainment of self is momentary.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is no past or future at all.

original: thams cad las chung ba'i dbyibs kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i khyad par de nyid mi rigs par bshad do //
analyzed: thams cad las chung ba'i dbyibs kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i khyad par de nyid mi rigs par bshad do //
translated: It is unreasonable to say that there is a special state of shape that is smaller than all others.

original: yang na skad cig mar byed pas skad cig ma ste med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na skad cig mar byed pas skad cig ma ste med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, it is momentary because it acts in a moment, and it is momentary because it is nonexistent.

original: de yang dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de yang dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos so //
translated: Moreover, impermanence is a phenomenon called the cause of the destruction of things.

original: de 'di la yod pas lhan cig spyod pas skad cig ma'o /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas lhan cig spyod pas skad cig ma'o /
translated: Since it exists in this, it is momentary because it is a concomitant.

original: 'jig pa las gzhan pa'i mi rtag pa de'i rgyu la shin tu rnam par dpyad do //
analyzed: 'jig pa las gzhan pa'i mi rtag pa de'i rgyu la shin tu rnam par dpyad do //
translated: We have thoroughly analyzed the cause of its impermanence, which is different from destruction.

original: gal te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Or else, it is momentary because it is impermanent.üîΩIt is said that all conditioned states are momentary.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig mar khas mi len gyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig mar khas mi len gyi /
translated: But we do not accept that all conditioned states are momentary.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / gzugs 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa ma yin pa kha cig skad cig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / gzugs 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa ma yin pa kha cig skad cig ma yin gyi /
translated: Some material form, some thought and thoughtconcomitants, and some factors dissociated from thought are momentary.

original: lus kyang skad cig ma ma yin pas de bdag nyid du red pa'i 'og tu med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyang skad cig ma ma yin pas de bdag nyid du red pa'i 'og tu med pa ma yin te /
translated: But the body is not momentary, and thus, after having been the body of a human, it does not cease to exist in order to exist as the body of a god.

original: de'i phyir lus ni lus gzhan du 'pho bar mi 'gal lo snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus ni lus gzhan du 'pho bar mi 'gal lo snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, the body does not pass from one existence to another existence.

original: 'dus byas ni gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @5a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @5a * //
translated: Because conditioned factors are necessarily perishable.

original: ba ni / skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'jig pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: ba ni / skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'jig pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that that which is born is not mistaken with regard to its destruction.

original: gal te yang 'dus byas gdon mi za bar 'jig mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang 'dus byas gdon mi za bar 'jig mod kyi /
translated: Even if conditioned factors are necessarily perishable,

original: skyes ma thag tu ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: they are not perishable as soon as they are born.

original: 'jig pa 'dod na ni gdon mi za bar skyes ma thag tu khas blang bar bya'o ;
analyzed: 'jig pa 'dod na ni gdon mi za bar skyes ma thag tu khas blang bar bya'o ;
translated: If you admit that they perish, you must admit that they perish as soon as they are born.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa yin no //
translated: Because the destruction of a thing is without cause.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir skyes ma thag tu mi 'gyur ba zhig na de ni rgyu med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir skyes ma thag tu mi 'gyur ba zhig na de ni rgyu med pa yang yin no //
translated: If it were to have a cause, it would not be momentary, because it would depend on a cause, and yet it has no cause.

original: gal te skyes ma thag tu mi 'dod na ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur bas 'dus byas 'jig pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skyes ma thag tu mi 'dod na ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur bas 'dus byas 'jig pa med par gyur na /
translated: If you do not accept that it is momentary, then it would not be momentary later on either, and conditioned factors would not be subject to destruction.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that conditioned factors are subject to destruction as soon as they are produced.

original: 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid la rgyu 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba yin la /üîΩbya ba ma yin pa nyid ni rgyu med pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su smos so //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid la rgyu 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba yin la / bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni rgyu med pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su smos so //
translated: The question ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù is asked in order to determine the cause of destruction, which is causeless.üîΩThe reason given is that it is not an action.

original: bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir yin la brjod du med pa nyid ni dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir yin la brjod du med pa nyid ni dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: It is not an action because it is inexpressible, and inexpressibility is nonexistence,

original: rang gi ngo bo logs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo logs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mere negation of an intrinsic nature.

original: yi ge rnams ni go sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni go sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
translated: The words of the verse are easy to understand and do not need to be explained.

original: gang yang 'jig pa smos pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan ma yin pas de'i yang lan 'di nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang 'jig pa smos pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan ma yin pas de'i yang lan 'di nyid do //
translated: Since the statement ‚Äúit is destroyed‚Äù itself does not imply any other cause of destruction, this same response applies to that as well.

original: gal te dngos po skyes pa tsam ma yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te dngos po skyes pa tsam ma yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If it is not the mere arising of a thing, etc.

original: de nyid bzhin du 'gyur bar ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin las mi nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid bzhin du 'gyur bar ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin las mi nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not logical that it would be just like that, because it would not deteriorate from its intrinsic nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it is not tenable that it would be essentially different from that.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid ni gzhan nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid ni gzhan nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference itself does not occur without otherness.

original: shing la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: With respect to trees, etc., etc. The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes forms, etc.

original: 'jig pa mig la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa mig la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: Since destruction is not an object of the eye, etc., he asks:

original: re zhig khyod shing la sogs pa dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig khyod shing la sogs pa dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: First, with respect to trees, etc., etc.

original: de yod na de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yod na de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because if it did exist, it would be visible.

original: gal te me dang 'brel pa las shing la sogs pa dag 'jig pa ma yin na ni snga ma bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te me dang 'brel pa las shing la sogs pa dag 'jig pa ma yin na ni snga ma bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the destruction of firewood, etc. were not due to contact with fire, then they would be seen as before.

original: mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not seen.

original: de'i phyir de dag me dang 'brel pa las 'jig go zhes bya bar @5b nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag me dang 'brel pa las 'jig go zhes bya bar @5b nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that they are destroyed due to contact with fire.

original: nges pa'i phyir 'jig par mthong ngo zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: nges pa'i phyir 'jig par mthong ngo zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Since it is ascertained, it is said that destruction is seen,

original: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: but it is not by direct perception.

original: re zhig 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: This should be investigated, etc.

original: dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ni mthong ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ni mthong ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
translated: Since it is to be investigated, it is not seen.

original: gzhan dag ma skyes pas zhes bya ba ni me dang 'brel pa de dag skya ba ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ma skyes pas zhes bya ba ni me dang 'brel pa de dag skya ba ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say: because they are not produced, because the production of those in contact with fire is contradictory.

original: dper na rlung dang phrad pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na rlung dang phrad pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, due to contact with wind, etc.

original: 'di ni pha rol po la yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol po la yang grub pa yin no //
translated: This is also established for the opponent.

original: sgra dang mar me skad cig ma yin pas rang nyid zhig cing rlung dang lag pa dang phrad pas gegs byed pa dag yang ma skyes pas mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra dang mar me skad cig ma yin pas rang nyid zhig cing rlung dang lag pa dang phrad pas gegs byed pa dag yang ma skyes pas mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: Sound and the flame of a lamp are momentary, and so they cease by themselves. When they are obstructed by the contact of wind or the hand, they are not seen because another has not arisen.

original: rlung lag pa dang phrad pa sgra dang mar me zhig pas ma mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung lag pa dang phrad pa sgra dang mar me zhig pas ma mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the contact of the wind or the hand destroys the sound or the flame of the lamp so that they are not seen.

original: de ltar na re zhig mthong ba 'jug pa yang de dag gnas pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mthong ba 'jug pa yang de dag gnas pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, the engagement of seeing is not for the sake of their duration.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if not for that, then what?

original: sngar skyes pa zhig na gzhan dag skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa zhig na gzhan dag skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the sake of the arising of another when the former has ceased.

original: shing la sogs pa dag gi mthong ba dang ma mthong ba yang de dang 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa dag gi mthong ba dang ma mthong ba yang de dang 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The seeing and not seeing of trees, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: de lta bas na 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas pa bas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas pa bas /
translated: Thus, destruction is with a cause.

original: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout a cause‚Äù is to be established by inference,

original: mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not to be established by direct perception.

original: bshad zin to zhes bya ba la ci bshad ce na /
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba la ci bshad ce na /
translated: It has already been explained. What has been explained?

original: rgyu med pa ma yin te bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir gtan med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ma yin te bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir gtan med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It has been explained that destruction is not causeless, because it is an action, like a non-existent thing.

original: skye ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like arising,

original: skye ba ni bdag nyid du red pa yin la de ni 'du byed skad cig ma'am /
analyzed: skye ba ni bdag nyid du red pa yin la de ni 'du byed skad cig ma'am /
translated: Arising is the self-generation of an entity, and it is accepted that it is caused, whether the entity is momentary or not momentary.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa dag la rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa de bzhin du thams cad kyi 'jig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa dag la rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa de bzhin du thams cad kyi 'jig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, the destruction of all things would be caused.

original: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not accepted,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu'i dus ma nges pa'i phyir blo dang sgra dang me lce skad cig ma rnams kyi 'jig pa'i dus ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu'i dus ma nges pa'i phyir blo dang sgra dang me lce skad cig ma rnams kyi 'jig pa'i dus ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the time of the cause of destruction is not fixed, and it would follow, absurdly, that the time of the destruction of the mind, sound and a flame would not be fixed.

original: de'i phyir blo la sogs pa dag ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo la sogs pa dag ltar /
translated: Therefore, like the mind and so on,

original: thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du khas blang par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du khas blang par bya'o //
translated: it should be accepted that all things are without cause.

original: blo gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no contact between two minds.

original: blo snga ma'i dus nas blo phyi ma yod pa ni ma yin pas ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa sngar gyi blo'i 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: blo snga ma'i dus nas blo phyi ma yod pa ni ma yin pas ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa sngar gyi blo'i 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Since the later mind does not exist at the time of the earlier mind, how could the non-existent cause the disintegration of the earlier mind?

original: blo phyi ma'i dus na yang blo snga ma zhig pas ji ltar zhig @6a * //üîΩzin pa 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: blo phyi ma'i dus na yang blo snga ma zhig pas ji ltar zhig @6a * // zin pa 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
translated: And since the earlier mind has already disintegrated at the time of the later mind, how could the already disintegrated cause the disintegration of the earlier mind?

original: ci ste yang blo phyi ma'i dus na blo snga ma gnas so snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang blo phyi ma'i dus na blo snga ma gnas so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the earlier mind exists at the time of the later mind,

original: de'i phyir the tshom dang nges pa'i shes pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom dang nges pa'i shes pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said, ‚Äúdoubt and knowledge,‚Äù

original: sgra la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: and the same should be said of sound.üîΩWhen clear minds and sounds

original: gang gi tshe blo dang sgra gsal ba dag gi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo dang sgra gsal ba dag gi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: and so on.

original: gang yang gnas pa rgyu med pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang yang gnas pa rgyu med pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Whatever is permanent has no cause of cessationüîΩbecause it is independent of other things.

original: slob dpon dpal la na ni skyes pa rnams la gnas pa'i rgyu med pas de'i phyir de nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: slob dpon dpal la na ni skyes pa rnams la gnas pa'i rgyu med pas de'i phyir de nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Master ≈örƒ´lƒÅta says that since there is no cause for the endurance of things that have arisen, that very non-cause is the cause of their cessation.

original: de'i lan du rgyu med pa ni rgyu yin par 'os pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i lan du rgyu med pa ni rgyu yin par 'os pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúA non-cause is not suitable to be a cause.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a non-entity.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a cause of destruction.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBy the power of virtue and non-virtue.‚Äù

original: de la chos ni phan 'dogs pa ma ltos te /
analyzed: de la chos ni phan 'dogs pa ma ltos te /
translated: Regarding that, virtue is that which benefits without dependence.

original: mar me'i me lce dag skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: mar me'i me lce dag skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: It is the cause of the arising of the flame of a lamp.

original: chos ma yin pa ni gnod pa byed pa la ste 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni gnod pa byed pa la ste 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Non-virtue is that which harms, the cause of destruction.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa dag kyang skad cig la 'jug pa thob pa dang gegs byed bar 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa dag kyang skad cig la 'jug pa thob pa dang gegs byed bar 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, virtue and non-virtue, the causes of arising and destruction, are not suitable to obtain the engagement of a momentary thing and to obstruct it.

original: skyes bu la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir chos ma yin pas gegs byas nas chos kyis 'jug pa thob pa yin dang / sgron me'i me lce dag skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: skyes bu la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir chos ma yin pas gegs byas nas chos kyis 'jug pa thob pa yin dang / sgron me'i me lce dag skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: In order to benefit a person, non-virtue obstructs and virtue obtains the engagement of a momentary thing, and the flame of a lamp arises.

original: skyes bu la gnod par bya ba'i phyir chos la gegs byas nas chos ma yin pas 'jug pa thob pa yin yang 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bu la gnod par bya ba'i phyir chos la gegs byas nas chos ma yin pas 'jug pa thob pa yin yang 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Even though one has obtained the opportunity to engage in non-Dharma by obstructing Dharma for the sake of harming a person, one will not engage in it.

original: de bzhin du chos ma yin pa la yang bzlog pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos ma yin pa la yang bzlog pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should state the opposite in regard to non-Dharma.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa de gnyis kyang skad cig re re la yin zhing /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa de gnyis kyang skad cig re re la yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, those two, arising and disintegrating, occur in each moment.

original: stobs dang ldan pas stobs chung ba la gegs byed pa yang yin la /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pas stobs chung ba la gegs byed pa yang yin la /
translated: And the powerful obstructs the weak.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gi stobs dang ldan pa dang stobs chung ba'i rgyu ni skad cig re re la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gi stobs dang ldan pa dang stobs chung ba'i rgyu ni skad cig re re la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the cause of the powerful and weak of Dharma and non-Dharma does not exist in each moment.

original: de la stobs chung ba'i phyir chos kyis ma yin pa la gegs byed na yang skad cig de nyid la chos ma yin pa stobs dang ldan pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de la stobs chung ba'i phyir chos kyis ma yin pa la gegs byed na yang skad cig de nyid la chos ma yin pa stobs dang ldan pa nyid dam /
translated: If the weak Dharma obstructs non-Dharma, then in that very moment the non-Dharma becomes powerful.

original: gang las slar chos ma yin pas chos la gegs byed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang las slar chos ma yin pas chos la gegs byed par 'gyur bas /
translated: Or else, from where would the non-Dharma arise again to obstruct the Dharma?

original: chos stobs chung ba nyid du gal 'gyur /
analyzed: chos stobs chung ba nyid du gal 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the Dharma would become weak.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su brtags par yang 'grig dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su brtags par yang 'grig dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to accept this as a thorough examination.

original: rgyu yongs su brtags pa chos dang chos ma @6b yin pa 'jug pa thob pa dang gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di yang 'dus byas thams cad la nus ta /
analyzed: rgyu yongs su brtags pa chos dang chos ma @6b yin pa 'jug pa thob pa dang gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di yang 'dus byas thams cad la nus ta /
translated: This examination of the cause, which has the characteristic of the engagement of virtue and nonvirtue and the obstruction of attainment, is also possible for all conditioned phenomena.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: Therefore, it is established that all conditioned phenomena are momentary,

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa la ma gtogs pa'i 'jig par rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa la ma gtogs pa'i 'jig par rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because destruction does not depend on a cause that is not included in virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de'i phyir brtsad mi dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtsad mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, there is no need for further debate.

original: rgyu yang 'jig pa por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu yang 'jig pa por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe cause would be the destroyer,‚Äù

original: chos par bya ba dang chos par byed pa'i rdzas phrad pa las snga ma snga ma 'gags kyang rim gyis tshos byed las skyes pa phyi ma phyi ma rnams la tshos pa dang ches tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa 'byung ba mthong ste /
analyzed: chos par bya ba dang chos par byed pa'i rdzas phrad pa las snga ma snga ma 'gags kyang rim gyis tshos byed las skyes pa phyi ma phyi ma rnams la tshos pa dang ches tshos pa dang / ches cher tshos pa 'byung ba mthong ste /
translated: we see that the substance that is the object of cooking and the substance that is the agent of cooking come into contact, and although the former ceases, the latter arises in sequence from the agent of cooking, such as being cooked, being well cooked, and being very well cooked.

original: de la ches tshos pa 'byung ba ni me dang 'brel pa las tshos pa dag 'jig par 'dod na /
analyzed: de la ches tshos pa 'byung ba ni me dang 'brel pa las tshos pa dag 'jig par 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the cooking is destroyed by contact with fire,

original: de lta na rgyu nyid 'jig pa por 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na rgyu nyid 'jig pa por 'gyur na /
translated: then the cause itself would be the destroyer.

original: gang kho na las tshos byed las skyes pa rnams 'byung ba nyid las 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang kho na las tshos byed las skyes pa rnams 'byung ba nyid las 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not logical to say that what is produced from the cause of cooking is destroyed by the cause itself.

original: dus tha dad pa dag rgyu gcig tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig me ni skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa ni gzhan yin la /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa dag rgyu gcig tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig me ni skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa ni gzhan yin la /
translated: Because it is not established that different times are the same cause.

original: 'jig par byed pa ne gzhan yin no snyam du sems pa de la /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa ne gzhan yin no snyam du sems pa de la /
translated: If you think that because fire is momentary, one thing produces it and another destroys it,üîΩthen we say:

original: yang na rgyu med bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu med bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Or else, without a cause, there would be no distinction.

original: 'bras bu 'dra ba gzhan gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rgyu 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dra ba gzhan gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rgyu 'dra ba'o //
translated: Similar causes are causes of similar effects.

original: 'jig rten na rgyu 'dra ba rnams ni 'bras bu yang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rgyu 'dra ba rnams ni 'bras bu yang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
translated: In the world, one sees that similar causes have similar effects.

original: gal te des sngar skyed pa mi 'jig na /
analyzed: gal te des sngar skyed pa mi 'jig na /
translated: If what was previously produced is not destroyed,üîΩthen

original: de'i phyi ma rnams rgyu med par skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyi ma rnams rgyu med par skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the latter would arise without a cause.

original: ci ste skad cig ma'i phyir dang de'i gnas skabs mi srid pa'i phyir de ma thag tu skye bar sems na /
analyzed: ci ste skad cig ma'i phyir dang de'i gnas skabs mi srid pa'i phyir de ma thag tu skye bar sems na /
translated: If you think that it arises immediately after the former, because it is momentary and because its state is impossible,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i sa'i rdzas sred pa'i phyir de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i sa'i rdzas sred pa'i phyir de ni mi rigs so //
translated: then that is not reasonable, because the substance of earth is sought apart from form, etc.

original: re zhig me lce gzhan dag la zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig me lce gzhan dag la zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The text continues:

original: me lce rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: me lce rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because the flames are momentary.

original: thal ba dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: thal ba dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The text continues:

original: gang gi phyir thal ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa de rnams skad cig ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thal ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa de rnams skad cig ma ma yin no //
translated: because the ashes, etc., that are cited as examples are not momentary.

original: yang na khyed dang rtsod pa na skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs te brtag par bya ba dag na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na khyed dang rtsod pa na skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs te brtag par bya ba dag na zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, when you argue with us, you accept momentariness and then you should investigate,

original: brtag pa gang gis na skyed par byed pa nyid 'jig par byed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brtag pa gang gis na skyed par byed pa nyid 'jig par byed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: by what means a producer would not be a destroyer.

original: der me dang 'brel ba ci zhig byed ce na zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgal te chu dag me dang 'brel pa mi @7a * //
analyzed: der me dang 'brel ba ci zhig byed ce na zhes bya ba ni / gal te chu dag me dang 'brel pa mi @7a * //
translated: What function does it perform in relation to fire?

original: 'jig na / gang las bskol ban zad par 'gyur ba me dang 'brel pa dag ci zhig byed na ni /
analyzed: 'jig na / gang las bskol ban zad par 'gyur ba me dang 'brel pa dag ci zhig byed na ni /
translated: If water does not perish through contact with fire, what function does it perform in relation to fire, since it is boiled by fire?

original: de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i me'i khams mthu'i sgo nas 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i me'i khams mthu'i sgo nas 'phel bar byed do //
translated: It causes the fire element that is not distinct from it to increase in strength.

original: de'i mthus na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i mthus na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Through the power of that,

original: me'i khams mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba chu dag gi skad cig ma dang por rang gi ngo bos skad cig gzhan nyam chung ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /üîΩde yang de bzhin du yin pa nas /
analyzed: me'i khams mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba chu dag gi skad cig ma dang por rang gi ngo bos skad cig gzhan nyam chung ba'i rgyur 'gyur la / de yang de bzhin du yin pa nas /
translated: the first moment of water that is predominant in the fire element becomes the cause of the next moment‚Äôs weakness in its own nature.

original: shin tu nyam chung ba'i bar du gyur pas skad cig gzhan dang 'brel bar mi byed de de shin tu nyam chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu nyam chung ba'i bar du gyur pas skad cig gzhan dang 'brel bar mi byed de de shin tu nyam chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is also the case until it becomes extremely weak and does not connect with another moment, because it is extremely weak.

original: de ltar chu dag gi rgyun 'chad par 'gyur gyi me dang 'brel ba dag gis 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chu dag gi rgyun 'chad par 'gyur gyi me dang 'brel ba dag gis 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus the stream of water is severed, but it does not perish through contact with fire.

original: rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is by nature perishable means because it is by nature subject to destruction.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'byung ba tsam gyis 'jig pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam gyis 'jig pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Because it perishes as soon as it arises.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yul gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang rtsva'i me bzhin zhes rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yul gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang rtsva'i me bzhin zhes rgyas par smos te /
translated: That is why he says, ‚ÄúIt is like a firebrand circle or a flame of a lamp,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar rtsva'i me skad cig ma nyid yin yang rtsva'i yul du 'dab chags par 'byung bas me 'gro'o zhes bsnyad pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang yul gzhan dag tu 'dab chags par 'byung ba la mngon pa'i rgyal byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar rtsva'i me skad cig ma nyid yin yang rtsva'i yul du 'dab chags par 'byung bas me 'gro'o zhes bsnyad pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang yul gzhan dag tu 'dab chags par 'byung ba la mngon pa'i rgyal byed do //
translated: Just as a firebrand circle is momentary, but appears to be continuous in the same place because it arises in a series in the same place, so too, the flame of a lamp.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re dbyibs ni rdzas su med de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re dbyibs ni rdzas su med de /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that shape does not exist as a real substance.

original: de bcom na de'i blo med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de bcom na de'i blo med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Because when it is destroyed, the cognition of it does not exist, like a pot and so on.

original: gal te rdzas su med na der gdags pa'i rgyu ni gang zhig yin la /
analyzed: gal te rdzas su med na der gdags pa'i rgyu ni gang zhig yin la /
translated: If it does not exist as a real substance, what is the cause of its designation?

original: der btags pa'i bye brag kyang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: der btags pa'i bye brag kyang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the difference that is designated there?

original: de'i phyir phyogs gcig gi sgor zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //üîΩ'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gcig gi sgor zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthe difference that is designated there is due to the difference in the manifestation of the color.‚Äù

original: gdags pa'i rgyu ni kha dog yin la /
analyzed: gdags pa'i rgyu ni kha dog yin la /
translated: This is what is being said: The cause of the designation is color.

original: der btags pa'i bye brag ni kha dog 'byung ba'i bye brag las so //
analyzed: der btags pa'i bye brag ni kha dog 'byung ba'i bye brag las so //
translated: The difference that is designated there is due to the difference in the manifestation of color.

original: 'di nyid la dpe ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dpe ni /
translated: In this regard, an example is given:

original: dper na mgal me zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na mgal me zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For example, it is like a firebrand.

analyzed: ji ltar mgal me'i gzugs ni ring po dang zlum po zhes bya ba'i dngos po gzhan med kyang skye ba'i bye brag las ring po dang zlum por btags pa'i bye brag gi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du gzhan du yang yin no //
translated: Just as the form of a firebrand is not a different thing called ‚Äúlong‚Äù or ‚Äúround,‚Äù but is the cause of the difference that is designated as ‚Äúlong‚Äù or ‚Äúround‚Äù due to the difference in its arising, so it is in other cases as well.

analyzed: mgal me'i dpe yang mi nus so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says that the example of a firebrand is not possible.

original: gtso bo ni btags par @7b yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo ni btags par @7b yod pa yin la /

analyzed: mgal me'i ring po la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa bzhin gtso bo'i dbyibs so //
translated: Just as the length, etc., of a firebrand do not exist, so the shape of the primary nature does not exist.

original: de'i phyir mgal me bzhin kha dog dang dbyibs dag btags pa dag tu rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mgal me bzhin kha dog dang dbyibs dag btags pa dag tu rigs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: de lta na 'o na ji ltar gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par btags par rigs she na /

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams la gtso bo'i bdag tu btags pa med pa'i phyir dang / phung po bzhi rnams la gtso bo'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams la gtso bo'i bdag tu btags pa med pa'i phyir dang / phung po bzhi rnams la gtso bo'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no imputation of a primary self in pots, cloth, etc. and because there is no primary self in the four aggregates.

original: zhen pa'i khyad par las kha dog nyid la dbyibs su btags pa ni ma yin zhes 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: zhen pa'i khyad par las kha dog nyid la dbyibs su btags pa ni ma yin zhes 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say that color is imputed as shape due to a specific adherence, but not that shape is a real entity.

original: dbang po'i gzung bya mtshungs pa rnams la yang zhen pa'i khyad par las don gyi khyad par mthong ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i gzung bya mtshungs pa rnams la yang zhen pa'i khyad par las don gyi khyad par mthong ste /

original: grang ba dang sra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: grang ba dang sra ba bzhin no //

original: der zhen pa'i khyad par yod pas kyang ring po'o dkar po'i snyam pa des kyang don gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der zhen pa'i khyad par yod pas kyang ring po'o dkar po'i snyam pa des kyang don gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though there is a specific adherence to that, it is not a different object, such as long or white.

original: de'i phyir 'dus pa'i mthar thug pa'i rnams la yongs su gcod pa'i bye brag gi rgyur gyur pa dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab rnams kyang der skyes so zhes aa ba s'i ya tam /üîΩgal te gang du 'dus pa de dag mi 'thad na /

original: der kha dog skye ba la yang dbyibs med do //
analyzed: der kha dog skye ba la yang dbyibs med do //
translated: If the collection is not tenable, then shape does not exist in the arising of color there.

original: dper na mar me la sogs pa skye ba la yongs su ma bcad par kha dog dang dbyibs su mi 'gyur te tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na mar me la sogs pa skye ba la yongs su ma bcad par kha dog dang dbyibs su mi 'gyur te tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //

original: me'i khams dang dro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: me'i khams dang dro ba bzhin no //

original: gal te yod na ni gnyis gzung 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzugs can gnyis te /üîΩmig dang reg pas kyang ring po la sogs par shes pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gal te yod na ni gnyis gzung 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzugs can gnyis te / mig dang reg pas kyang ring po la sogs par shes pa'i phyir ro ;

original: / gzugs kyi skye mched la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: / gzugs kyi skye mched la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: because long and so on would be apprehended by both the eye sense faculty and the body sense faculty.üîΩThe form base is different

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched tha dad pa yin la /

original: dbyibs kyang gzugs kyi skye mched kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs kyang gzugs kyi skye mched kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de ni re zhig reg pas 'dzin par mi 'thad do //

analyzed: gal te kha dog kho na skye ba'i khyad par la ring po la sogs pa'i blo yin na /

original: mdo sde pa'i 'di skyon du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i 'di skyon du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi tshe lus kyi dbang pos mun pa la ring po'o snyam du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe ring po la sogs pa'i shes pa ni @8a * //

original: de las de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ste /

analyzed: dbang po rnams dang skye mched rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir yang ji ltar reg bya ba la zhes bya ba la rgyas par smos so //

analyzed: ji ltar reg bya de nyid da ltar gnas pa yan lag re re nas gzung ba na phyis nas ring po la sogs par shes par 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: kha dog las don gzhan du gyur pa ring po la sogs pa gzung ba ni ma yin no zhes yid ches par bya'o //

analyzed: de ni rdzas su yod pa'i dbyibs la mi rung ngo //
translated: The shape of the collection is not a real entity separate from the parts, because
