translated: But anger and so on are not like that, so they are explained as being different.

original: 'di ltar khro ba la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khro ba la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus anger and so on are abandoned by the path of meditation and are concomitant with mental consciousness.üîΩIf that is so, then arising and so on and cessation and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment would not be intrinsically virtuous.

original: gal te de ltar na skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba ma yin par 'gyur na skyon cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba ma yin par 'gyur na skyon cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the error if that is so?

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir de dag kun slong gi sgo nas dge bar brjod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir de dag kun slong gi sgo nas dge bar brjod /
translated: If that is so, why are they said to be virtuous from the perspective of motivation?

original: 'di dag gis kun slong gi sems skal ba mnyam pa ni rnyed par sla ba ma yin no //üîΩkun slong las de ltar brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gis kun slong gi sems skal ba mnyam pa ni rnyed par sla ba ma yin no // kun slong las de ltar brjod do zhe na /
translated: It is not easy to find a similar case.

original: kun slong las bya ba la sogs pa rnams ai tya tra ki tsi tva sha te /
analyzed: kun slong las bya ba la sogs pa rnams ai tya tra ki tsi tva sha te /
translated: If you say that the action is so called because of the intention,üîΩthen the action would be nonvirtuous when the intention is nonvirtuous,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nyid na de dag mi dge ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nyid na de dag mi dge ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because the intention is nonvirtuous in the future.

original: de dag sngar dge ba la phyis kun slong las mi dge bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag sngar dge ba la phyis kun slong las mi dge bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that which was previously virtuous and later becomes nonvirtuous because of the intention.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dir de'i rang bzhin yongs su bor bas phyogs gcig ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dir de'i rang bzhin yongs su bor bas phyogs gcig ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: It is not a part because it abandons its nature.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir kha cig ni 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir kha cig ni 'dod do //
translated: Some say: This is so.

original: sngar yang de la bltos nas dge ba'i nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar yang de la bltos nas dge ba'i nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is previously established as virtuous in dependence on that.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos de dag kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos de dag kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes those concomitant with shame and embarrassment.

original: thob pa rnams ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: thob pa rnams ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How are the obtainments?

original: gal te bya ba la sogs pa rnams kun nas bslangs bas dge ba nyid yin na /üîΩde ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis kun nas bslangs pa'i thob pa rnams dge ba @24a * //
analyzed: gal te bya ba la sogs pa rnams kun nas bslangs bas dge ba nyid yin na / de ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis kun nas bslangs pa'i thob pa rnams dge ba @24a * //
translated: If virtue is due to being motivated by action, etc.,

original: nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the obtainments motivated by afflicted minds would not be virtue.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: the tshom gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe dge ba'i chos kyi thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: the tshom gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe dge ba'i chos kyi thob pa rnams so //
translated: the obtainments of virtuous phenomena when roots of virtue are reconnected through doubt and when connecting with existence.

original: de rnams ni don dam pa'am ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: de rnams ni don dam pa'am ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: Are they ultimate virtue or natural virtue?

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas dge ba nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas dge ba nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that they are virtuous by being concomitant with virtue,

original: de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because they are not the nature of nirvana, etc.,

original: don dam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang bas dge ba rnams kyang yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang bas dge ba rnams kyang yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the virtues of ultimate virtue, natural virtue, concomitant virtue, and virtue that is motivated are all excluded.

original: de'i phyir thob pa de rnams ji ltar dge ba 'di brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thob pa de rnams ji ltar dge ba 'di brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to explain how those obtainments are virtuous.

original: bsam gtan gyi thob pa rnams dang sprul pa'i sems kyi thob pa rnams ji ltar lung ma bstan yin pa brjod dgos she na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi thob pa rnams dang sprul pa'i sems kyi thob pa rnams ji ltar lung ma bstan yin pa brjod dgos she na /
translated: It is necessary to explain how the obtainment of absorption and the obtainment of emanation minds are neutral.

original: de'i chos dang ldan cig skyes pa'i thob pa rnams la dgongs nas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i chos dang ldan cig skyes pa'i thob pa rnams la dgongs nas de ltar bshad do //
translated: That is explained from the perspective of the obtainment of those that arise simultaneously with the mind.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: de ni ma yin te mnyam pa'i sems kyi rten gyis kyang skye bas skyon med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te mnyam pa'i sems kyi rten gyis kyang skye bas skyon med do zhes zer ro //
translated: That is not so, because they arise by the support of an equivalent mind.

original: de rnams ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sems la skye ba'i rkyen nyid du bltos pa yin gyi dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sems la skye ba'i rkyen nyid du bltos pa yin gyi dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: These are seen as conditions for the arising of minds of dissimilar type, but they are not by nature virtuous and so on.

original: gal te kun nas slong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'dod na ni des na 'o na dge ba rnam gnyis kho na khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te kun nas slong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'dod na ni des na 'o na dge ba rnam gnyis kho na khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If you do not accept that they are virtuous and so on by nature through being concomitant with motivation, then you should accept that there are only two types of virtue:

original: don dam pa dang ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa dang ngo bo nyid do //
translated: ultimate virtue and natural virtue.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúBecause it is the nature of all suffering to engage.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o /
translated: All suffering is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de 'jug pa'i bdag nyid ni 'khor ba ste mchog tu mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: de 'jug pa'i bdag nyid ni 'khor ba ste mchog tu mi bde ba'o //
translated: The nature of engaging in them is samsara, which is supremely unpleasant.

original: mi bde ba'i don dang mi dge ba'i don gyis 'khor ba ni don dam par mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: mi bde ba'i don dang mi dge ba'i don gyis 'khor ba ni don dam par mi dge ba'o //
translated: Because it has the meaning of unpleasantness and the meaning of nonvirtue, samsara is ultimate nonvirtue.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: In another way, it is the self-existence of the entry of all, because it is the basis of all suffering, such as birth, etc.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni sdug bsngal gsum yin la 'khor ba yang de dag 'jug pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni sdug bsngal gsum yin la 'khor ba yang de dag 'jug pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: All suffering is the three kinds of suffering, and cyclic existence is the self-existence of their entry.

original: nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman la sogs pa dper bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman la sogs pa dper bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The example is like a disease, unwholesome medicine, etc.

original: 'khor ba ni mchog tu mi dge ba yin pas nad kyi dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni mchog tu mi dge ba yin pas nad kyi dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since cyclic existence is extremely unwholesome, it should be given as an example of a disease.

original: chags pa la @24b sogs pa dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi dge ba yin te /
analyzed: chags pa la @24b sogs pa dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi dge ba yin te /
translated: Attachment, etc. are unwholesome by nature.

original: de'i phyir chags pa la sogs pa dag ni ma 'phrod pa'i sman gyi dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa la sogs pa dag ni ma 'phrod pa'i sman gyi dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, attachment, etc. should be given as an example of unwholesome medicine.

original: chags pa la sogs pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag gi ngo bo ma yin pas mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi 'phrod pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung bas dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag gi ngo bo ma yin pas mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi 'phrod pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung bas dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since they are not of the nature of those associated with attachment, etc., those associated with them should be given as an example of a drink mixed with unwholesome medicine.

original: lus dang ngag gi las dang skye ba la sogs pa de dag gis kun nas bslang ba rnams ni kun nas bslang ba mi dge ba yin gyi ngo bo dang mtshungs par ldan pas ma yin pas mi 'phrod pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las byung ba'i
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dang skye ba la sogs pa de dag gis kun nas bslang ba rnams ni kun nas bslang ba mi dge ba yin gyi ngo bo dang mtshungs par ldan pas ma yin pas mi 'phrod pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las byung ba'i
translated: Nonvirtuous in terms of motivation refers to physical and verbal karma and that motivated by it, but not by nature or concomitance.

original: 'o mas dper brjod par bya'o //üîΩde lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o mas dper brjod par bya'o // de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is like milk that comes from a cow that eats grain mixed with poison.

original: 'khor ba don dam par mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba don dam par mi dge ba yin la /
translated: If that is so, then samsara would be nonvirtuous in the ultimate sense,

original: 'khor ba'i khungs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad cung zad kyang lung du bstan pa'am dge bar mi 'gyur la ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i khungs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad cung zad kyang lung du bstan pa'am dge bar mi 'gyur la ;
translated: because all contaminated things belong to the source of samsara and not even a little would be either ethically neutral or virtuous.

original: zag pa med pa'i kho na lung du ma bstan pa 'am dge par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i kho na lung du ma bstan pa 'am dge par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And it would follow that uncontaminated states would be either neutral or virtuous.

original: don dam par de de skad du bshad kyi dgongs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam par de de skad du bshad kyi dgongs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: The ultimate truth is explained in this way, but the intention is that the characteristics of contaminated virtue, nonvirtue, and neutral states are as follows.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can ni dge ba'o //
translated: That which has a pleasant karmic maturation is virtuous.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba can ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba can ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: That which has an unpleasant karmic maturation is nonvirtue.

original: rnam par smin pa med pa ni lung du ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa ni lung du ma bstan pa ste /
translated: That which has no karmic maturation is neutral.

original: rnam par smin pa bde ba dang bde ba can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa'i phyir brda mi 'phrod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa bde ba dang bde ba can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa'i phyir brda mi 'phrod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is neutral because it is neither pleasant nor unpleasant and because it does not mature.

original: don dam par lung ma bstan pa brten pa dag zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrnam grangs med par lung du ma bstan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lung ma bstan pa brten pa dag zhes bya ba ni / rnam grangs med par lung du ma bstan pa dag yin te /
translated: The ultimate truth is neutral because it is not a basis.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate truth is neutral without synonyms because it is free of the four characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: ci ste 'byung ba chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'byung ba chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: The great elements are not virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: las kyi rten 'byung ba rnams kyang sems gcig gis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir las bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems so //
analyzed: las kyi rten 'byung ba rnams kyang sems gcig gis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir las bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems so //
translated: Also, the primary elements that are the basis of karma would be virtuous or nonvirtuous because they are motivated by a single mind, just as karma is.

original: byed pa po ni las la sems pa yin gyi 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: byed pa po ni las la sems pa yin gyi 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The agent is the mind that intends karma, not the primary elements.

original: 'ga' yang 'byung ba rnams bya'o snyam @25a * //üîΩdu ste / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'byung ba rnams bya'o snyam @25a * // du ste / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: No one thinks, I will produce the primary elements.

original: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kun nas bslang bar bya'o snyam du'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kun nas bslang bar bya'o snyam du'o //
translated: One does not manifest a virtuous or nonvirtuous mind, but rather one thinks, I will produce indicative form of body and speech.

original: gal te bsam pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i nyid yin gyi kun nas bslang ba tsam gis ma yin na mnyam par gzhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te bsam pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i nyid yin gyi kun nas bslang ba tsam gis ma yin na mnyam par gzhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: If virtue and nonvirtue exist due to the power of intention and not due to the power of motivation, then the text states, ‚ÄúOne who is equipoised in meditative equipoise would not possess virtue or nonvirtue.‚Äù

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni 'di snyam du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni 'di snyam du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: One who is equipoised in meditative equipoise does not think, I will produce nonindicative form.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: nyon mongs pas nyes par spyad pa'i gnyen po'i dbang gis bsam gtan zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag kyang yod par bsam mo zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas nyes par spyad pa'i gnyen po'i dbang gis bsam gtan zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag kyang yod par bsam mo zhe na /
translated: It should be considered that there are also the absorptions and uncontaminated vows that are antidotes to negative action due to affliction.

original: nyon mongs pas nyes par spyad pa'i gnyen po bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag yod mod kyi de dag kun nas bslang ba las de'i gnyen por bsam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas nyes par spyad pa'i gnyen po bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag yod mod kyi de dag kun nas bslang ba las de'i gnyen por bsam pa ma yin te /
translated: Although there are the absorptions and uncontaminated vows that are antidotes to negative action due to affliction, they are not considered antidotes to that since they are motivated by it.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag kha cig gis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag kha cig gis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore some do not understand this.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la rnam pa rig byed ma yin pa med par bsam mo zhes so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la rnam pa rig byed ma yin pa med par bsam mo zhes so //
translated: Some say: It should be considered that there is no nonindicative form in equipoise.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na bsam pa yod do zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na bsam pa yod do zhe na / de'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: If you say that there is intention in the state of equipoise,üîΩthen it would not be equipoise.

original: sa 'og ma'i sbyor ba'i sems de ni sa gong ma'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yin pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i sbyor ba'i sems de ni sa gong ma'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yin pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is said that the mind of preparation of a lower level is not suitable to motivate nonindicative form of a higher level.

original: gal te sbyor ba'i sems kyi dbang gis rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dge ba nyid du 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba'i sems kyi dbang gis rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dge ba nyid du 'dod na ni /
translated: If you maintain that nonindicative form is virtuous by the power of the mind that motivates it,üîΩthen it would be uncertain whether nonindicative form of the desire realm is virtuous or nonvirtuous because it would be influenced by afflicted concentration of its level.

original: rang gi sa pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs can gyis gzir ba sa 'og ma las nem nur du 'gyur te sbyor ba mi dge ba'i sems su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs can gyis gzir ba sa 'og ma las nem nur du 'gyur te sbyor ba mi dge ba'i sems su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind that motivates it would be nonvirtuous.

original: de lta na lha'i mig dang rna ba dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na lha'i mig dang rna ba dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: If that is so, then the divine eye and ear would be nonvirtuous because they are motivated by afflicted concentration.

original: sbyor ba'i dus na de dag sems pa yod pas so //üîΩ'di la 'bad par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'dir nyes pa 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba bden mod kyi 'di la lan gyi phyir 'bad par bya dgos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dus na de dag sems pa yod pas so // 'di la 'bad par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni / 'dir nyes pa 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba bden mod kyi 'di la lan gyi phyir 'bad par bya dgos so //
translated: They are not nonvirtuous because they are not motivated by afflicted concentration.üîΩThe divine eye and ear are not motivated by afflicted concentration because they are generated by the power of meditation.

original: gzhan dag ni lan du lus dang ngag gi las dag ni nam yang sems med par mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lan du lus dang ngag gi las dag ni nam yang sems med par mthong ste /
translated: The divine eye and ear are not motivated by afflicted concentration because they are generated by the power of meditation.

original: de'i phyir de ni sems kyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs @25b pa'i ngo bor 'byung ba rnams ni sems la ltos te 'byung ba ma yin te de rnams ni sems med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni sems kyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs @25b pa'i ngo bor 'byung ba rnams ni sems la ltos te 'byung ba ma yin te de rnams ni sems med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Therefore, they do not arise in dependence on mind, because they arise even when mind does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de rnams ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du sems kyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs par mi dbye'o zhes smra ste //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du sems kyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs par mi dbye'o zhes smra ste //
translated: Therefore, they are not classified as virtuous and so on by the power of mind, like eyes and so on.

original: de lta na ni 'o na skye ba la sogs pa dang ; thob pa la sogs pa rnams kyang kun nas bslang bas dge ba nyid du mi 'gyur te de dag gi don du mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa rnams la yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na skye ba la sogs pa dang ; thob pa la sogs pa rnams kyang kun nas bslang bas dge ba nyid du mi 'gyur te de dag gi don du mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa rnams la yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then arising and so on and obtainment and so forth would not be virtuous by motivation, because they do not engage for the sake of that and they arise even in mindless states.

original: 'di la lan ni skye ba la sogs pa dang thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni bdag nyid kyis dge ba la sogs pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni skye ba la sogs pa dang thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni bdag nyid kyis dge ba la sogs pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: The response to that is that arising and so on and obtainment and so forth are not virtuous and so on by their very nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: chos kyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag la /
translated: They are posited as virtuous and so on by the power of phenomena.

original: de dag gi 'byung ba chen po rnams bzhin kha cig tu bltos pas bdag nyid pas grub pa yod do //
analyzed: de dag gi 'byung ba chen po rnams bzhin kha cig tu bltos pas bdag nyid pas grub pa yod do //
translated: They are like the great elements that are the basis of the elements, because they are seen to be the self in some cases.

original: sems gzhan gyi dbang gis chos skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang dge ba la sogs pa nyid du skye'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan gyi dbang gis chos skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang dge ba la sogs pa nyid du skye'o //
translated: Also, phenomena such as arising that are dependent on other minds arise as virtuous and so on.

original: de bzhin du skye pa'i sems med par rgyun tu zhugs par ma mthong ba'i phyir sems snga ma'i 'phen pa nyid las de 'jug go //üîΩde ltar na lha'i mig dang rna ba dag kyang dge ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye pa'i sems med par rgyun tu zhugs par ma mthong ba'i phyir sems snga ma'i 'phen pa nyid las de 'jug go // de ltar na lha'i mig dang rna ba dag kyang dge ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, since one who is an enterer to the result of stream entry is not seen to be without the mind of birth, he engages in that through the projection of a former mind.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yin na sems ni bzlog pa'i phyir de ltar blun pa dang gzhan gyi dbang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yin na sems ni bzlog pa'i phyir de ltar blun pa dang gzhan gyi dbang ma yin la /

analyzed: kun nas bslang ba nyam chung ba nyid kyis nyam chung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //

analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i sems kyi dbang las chung ngu la sogs pa nyid do //

analyzed: der bshad pa ni sdom pa rnams kyi rang gi rigs la bltos pa'o //

original: nyes par spyad pa ni smad pa spyad pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa ni smad pa spyad pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar smad pa yin zhe na dam pa @33a * //

analyzed: rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: dgongs pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir smad pa'o //

analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni byed na zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //

original: 'du byed 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba rnams mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dus zhes bya ba'i ming 'di btags kyi rtag pa dang rdzas zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //

translated: The name time is given in order to manifest past, future and present formations. It is not eternal and not a substance.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'du byed 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag kho na yin par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'du byed 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag kho na yin par rtogs kyi /
translated: Thus, the past, future and present are understood to be only past, future and present formations.

original: rtag pa'i rdzas gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rdzas gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a permanent substance,

original: rtag pa la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for something permanent to be past, future, or present.

original: yang dag par blangs pa yod kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa yod kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though one has taken up the vow,

original: bdag gis skye ba gzhan du yang dge slong gi sdom pa dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par blang bar bya'o snyam du yang dag par blangs pa de yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis skye ba gzhan du yang dge slong gi sdom pa dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par blang bar bya'o snyam du yang dag par blangs pa de yod kyang ngo //
translated: even though one has taken up the vow, thinking, ‚ÄúI will take up the novice vow or the monk vow in another life,‚ÄùüîΩbecause the two vows are of different types,

original: skal ba mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ris mi mthun pa gzhan gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ris mi mthun pa gzhan gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two vows are subsumed in different classes.üîΩBecause one has not applied oneself to that vow,

original: des kyang der sbyor ba ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /üîΩskal ba mi 'dra ba'i lus des der te /
analyzed: des kyang der sbyor ba ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni / skal ba mi 'dra ba'i lus des der te /
translated: because one has not applied oneself to that vow,

original: yang dag par blang ba la sbyor ba ma byas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba la sbyor ba ma byas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: to the vow of the novice or the monk, in that body which is of a different type.

original: /'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: /'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: lus gang gis sdom pa yang dag par blang ba la sbyor ba'i lus de nyid la sdom pa skye'i lus gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus gang gis sdom pa yang dag par blang ba la sbyor ba'i lus de nyid la sdom pa skye'i lus gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: The vow arises in the body by which one applies oneself to taking the vow, not in another body.

original: mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdom pa yang dag par lan pa de lus gzhan gyis mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdom pa yang dag par lan pa de lus gzhan gyis mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not remember it, one does not remember the vow-taking in another body.

original: su zhig gegs byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: su zhig gegs byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: Who is the one who creates an obstacle?

original: de la rten skal ba mi nyams pa 'gegs med pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten skal ba mi nyams pa 'gegs med pa'o //
translated: The obstacle is the non-degeneration of the fortune of the basis.

original: nyin zhag gnyis pa la sogs pa la rten tha dad pa'i phyir de dag la de dang sbyor ba'i gegs med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyin zhag gnyis pa la sogs pa la rten tha dad pa'i phyir de dag la de dang sbyor ba'i gegs med pa ma yin no //
translated: In the second day and so on, the basis is different, and therefore there is no non-obstacle to applying oneself to that.

original: rten de nyid kyi der sbyor ba las gegs mi dran pa ma yin @35a * //
analyzed: rten de nyid kyi der sbyor ba las gegs mi dran pa ma yin @35a * //
translated: It is not that the obstacle is the non-memory of applying oneself to that very basis,

original: te ; sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one remembers the vow-taking.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar shi ba sdom pa skye bar rigs pa dang 'gal ba de ltar 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar shi ba sdom pa skye bar rigs pa dang 'gal ba de ltar 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as it is reasonable that the vow arises in one who has died, it is not so in this case, because it contradicts the reason.

original: 'di ltar / zla ba phyed la sogs par yang dag par len pa'i sems stobs dang ldan pa de ltar nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nyin zhag gi 'og tu sdom pa skye ba yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / zla ba phyed la sogs par yang dag par len pa'i sems stobs dang ldan pa de ltar nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nyin zhag gi 'og tu sdom pa skye ba yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, one who possesses the power of mind that properly takes up the precepts for a fortnight and so on does not properly take up the precepts for a day and night. Therefore, it is not contradictory for the vows to arise after a day and night.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i don dag la ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa rtog ges de kho na nyid khong du chud par mi nus te /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i don dag la ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa rtog ges de kho na nyid khong du chud par mi nus te /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says: ‚ÄúWith regard to the meaning of the Vinaya, those who are not omniscient and whose intellects do not comprehend reality are unable to understand it.

original: gang sdom pa de dag las kha cig ni tshogs kyi nang du gsol ba dang gzhi'i las kyis 'thob la /
analyzed: gang sdom pa de dag las kha cig ni tshogs kyi nang du gsol ba dang gzhi'i las kyis 'thob la /
translated: Some of these vows are obtained by requesting in the midst of the sa·πÖgha and by the basis of the rite.

original: kha cig ni gang zag gcig las gsol ba tsam gyis thob la /
analyzed: kha cig ni gang zag gcig las gsol ba tsam gyis thob la /
translated: Some are obtained by requesting from one person.

original: kha cig gis de yang med par thob pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig gis de yang med par thob pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod pa zhes zer ro //
translated: Some are obtained without that. What is the cause of this?‚Äù

original: mtshams med pa byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nges pa rnams la rten pa dang bral ba me shi ba lta bu rnams bkag ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nges pa rnams la rten pa dang bral ba me shi ba lta bu rnams bkag ste /
translated: Those who have committed heinous acts are certain to be related to their cause and effect, but they are prevented from being related to it, like the extinction of a fire.

original: mtshams med pa byed pa rnams ni rab tu dbyung bar mi bya bsnyen pa rdzogs par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa rnams ni rab tu dbyung bar mi bya bsnyen pa rdzogs par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who have committed heinous acts should not be allowed to go forth and should not be fully ordained.

original: de'i phyir gang de ltar 'thob kyi rnam pa gzhan ni ma yin zhes ston pas gzigs shing de kho na ltar bstan pa 'di ni sdom pa'i rigs kho na de ltar gnas pa yin pas 'di la rgyu btsal bar mi bya'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang de ltar 'thob kyi rnam pa gzhan ni ma yin zhes ston pas gzigs shing de kho na ltar bstan pa 'di ni sdom pa'i rigs kho na de ltar gnas pa yin pas 'di la rgyu btsal bar mi bya'o zhes smra'o //
translated: Therefore, since the Buddha has seen that vows are obtained in this way and not otherwise, and has taught this in this way, this is the only type of vow that exists. Therefore, do not seek a cause for it.

original: nyin zhag pa'i phyir thams cad bstan pa nyid do zhe na 'di grub pa la lan yin no //
analyzed: nyin zhag pa'i phyir thams cad bstan pa nyid do zhe na 'di grub pa la lan yin no //
translated: If you say that all vows are taught to last one day and night because they are one day and night vows, this is a response to a misconception.

original: 'di grub ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di grub ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this misconception established?

original: de'i phyir 'di lan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this is not a response.üîΩThe MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika school

original: dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dag kyang /üîΩji srid 'tsho dang nyin zhag pa //
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dag kyang / ji srid 'tsho dang nyin zhag pa //
translated: recite:üîΩVows for as long as one lives and one day vows

original: ji srid dus kyi sdom pa'o //üîΩzhes 'don to //
analyzed: ji srid dus kyi sdom pa'o //üîΩzhes 'don to //
translated: are temporal vows.

original: nyin zhag pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyin zhag pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is called a one-day vow.

original: gzhan du na zhag lnga'am zhag bcu pa yang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhag lnga'am zhag bcu pa yang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be taught as lasting five days or ten days.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du ni nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa bstan pa las nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du ni nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa bstan pa las nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that in all cases, the vow is taught as lasting one day.

original: 'di nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yin pa'i phyir de ltar bstan to zhes so //
analyzed: 'di nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yin pa'i phyir de ltar bstan to zhes so //
translated: It is taught in this way because it is a one-day vow.

original: 'on te dbang po gdul dka' ba rnams zhes bya @35b ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po gdul dka' ba rnams zhes bya @35b ba 'byung ste /
translated: But if the faculties are difficult to subdue, it is called a one-day vow.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni /
translated: The Master Samghabhadra says:

original: de ni gal te dbang po gdul dka' ba la bltos nas nyin zhag pa bstan ni dbang po ches gdul dka' ba la bltos nas yud tsam mam nyin zhag pa nyid bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gal te dbang po gdul dka' ba la bltos nas nyin zhag pa bstan ni dbang po ches gdul dka' ba la bltos nas yud tsam mam nyin zhag pa nyid bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is taught as a one-day vow in dependence on faculties that are difficult to subdue, then it is not explained as lasting a moment or one day in dependence on faculties that are very difficult to subdue.üîΩIt should be investigated whether it is possible.

original: de de ltar brtag gal nus zhes bya ba ni thal ma thag tu dbang po gdul dka' ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa ste /
analyzed: de de ltar brtag gal nus zhes bya ba ni thal ma thag tu dbang po gdul dka' ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa ste /
translated: This is what was just said, beginning with ‚Äúif the faculties are difficult to subdue.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni nyin zhag gi 'og tu yang sdom pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i lung med par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyin zhag gi 'og tu yang sdom pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i lung med par ston to //
translated: This indicates that there is no scriptural passage stating that vows arise after a day.

original: phyin chad sdom pa skye ba la yang zhes slob dpon gyis rgyas par smos pa la /
analyzed: phyin chad sdom pa skye ba la yang zhes slob dpon gyis rgyas par smos pa la /
translated: The Master Vasubandhu extensively states:

original: yang ci ltar rig pa dang mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar rig pa dang mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúVows arise after that, but how is it not contradictory to knowledge?‚Äù

original: lus skal ba 'dra ba'i phyir dang des der sbyor ba byas pa'i phyir dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus skal ba 'dra ba'i phyir dang des der sbyor ba byas pa'i phyir dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body is similar to the one who has the vows, because he applies himself to that, and because he remembers it.

original: phyin chad su la yang mi bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re khyim pa thams cad dbang po gdul dka' ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin chad su la yang mi bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re khyim pa thams cad dbang po gdul dka' ba ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not teach it to anyone after that‚Äù means that not all householders have difficult to tame faculties.

original: de'i phyir phyin chad skye ba mi srid pas nyin zhag gi 'og tu su la yang ma bstan to zhes bya bar shes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin chad skye ba mi srid pas nyin zhag gi 'og tu su la yang ma bstan to zhes bya bar shes so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible for them to generate vows after that, it is understood that it should not be taught to anyone after a day.üîΩIt is said that he receives it in that way.

original: de de ltar nod mod ces grag / grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni ma rangs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de ltar nod mod ces grag / grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni ma rangs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúit is said‚Äù is stated to indicate displeasure.

original: dus gzhan gyi bar du log par zhugs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩnyin zhag tu sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pas sdig pa'i bya ba byed pa ni sdom pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi bar du log par zhugs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la / nyin zhag tu sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pas sdig pa'i bya ba byed pa ni sdom pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not by engaging in sexual intercourse at another time.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: One who commits an evil action with the intention to commit evil for one day and night does not possess either a vow or negative commitments.

original: de lta na lo ni bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa la yang nyin zhag kho nar bsam pa log pa ma yin par zhugs pas de yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na lo ni bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa la yang nyin zhag kho nar bsam pa log pa ma yin par zhugs pas de yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then one would not obtain the one-day vow even if one does not have a perverted intention for just one day and night.

original: de'i phyir bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThe one-day vow is obtained relative to the time it is taken for, because it is taken for a specific period of time.‚Äù

original: sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni sdom pa bya ba'i mno bsam mo //
analyzed: sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni sdom pa bya ba'i mno bsam mo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith the intention to commit evil‚Äù means with the thought to take a vow.

original: rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlong with its associates‚Äù means along with its imprints.

original: de las skyes pa dang de'i rgyu'i bag chags de yod pas sems dge ba yang de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa dang de'i rgyu'i bag chags de yod pas sems dge ba yang de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Since it arises from that and the imprint of its cause exists, even a virtuous mind possesses that imprint.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúpossessing negative commitments.‚Äù

original: de ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pa rjes su 'brel ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pa rjes su 'brel ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Because he has not abandoned that, means because he has not abandoned the thought of committing sin.

original: de ma spangs pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas sdig pa'i bya ba yongs su ma btang @36a * //
analyzed: de ma spangs pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas sdig pa'i bya ba yongs su ma btang @36a * //
translated: Not abandoning that means not completely giving up the thought of committing sin.üîΩThis is stated in the sutra:

original: pa'o // de ni zas zos nas kyang nod par bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pa'o // de ni zas zos nas kyang nod par bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving eaten food, he should then take the precepts.‚Äù

original: yang ci nod pa'i snga rol tu zos pa la sdom pa skye 'am 'on te mi skye /
analyzed: yang ci nod pa'i snga rol tu zos pa la sdom pa skye 'am 'on te mi skye /
translated: Now, does the restraint arise before or after eating?

original: gal te skye na ni sdom par rnam par rig byed la rag las pa nyams par 'gyur la nad par yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skye na ni sdom par rnam par rig byed la rag las pa nyams par 'gyur la nad par yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arises before, then restraint would depend on informative form, and it would be pointless for the sick to take it.

original: sngar yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu mtshan las khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu mtshan las khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: It should be accepted from the sign of the prior acceptance.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyin zhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyin zhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not a one-day vow.

original: ci ste mi skye ba de lta na yang nyin zhag pa nyid la nod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste mi skye ba de lta na yang nyin zhag pa nyid la nod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does not arise, then it would be a one-day vow.

original: 'bogs pa dang nod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bogs pa dang nod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It would not be established by either receiving or bestowing.

original: sngar ram mnyam du smra na'o //
analyzed: sngar ram mnyam du smra na'o //
translated: If one says that it is prior or simultaneous,

original: yan lag brgyad tshang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad tshang ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcomplete with eight members‚Äù means

original: yan lag brgyad kho na yang dag par nod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad kho na yang dag par nod par bya ba ste /
translated: that the eight members are taken up completely.

original: spong ba rnams phan tshun rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba rnams phan tshun rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the members are mutually dependent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir srog gcod spong ba pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid tha dad pa bzhi po yang rgyud gcig la cig car 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir srog gcod spong ba pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid tha dad pa bzhi po yang rgyud gcig la cig car 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the four characteristics of the abstention from taking life, etc.,

original: spong ba nyung du dang ches mang po la rag las pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde las gzhan du ma nos pa ni legs par spyad pa tsam du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spong ba nyung du dang ches mang po la rag las pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de las gzhan du ma nos pa ni legs par spyad pa tsam du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: are simultaneous in a single mental continuum, because they are not dependent on a lesser or greater number of abstentions.üîΩThe other abstentions are merely good conduct.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sdom pa legs par spyad pa las khyad par du byed pa ste /
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sdom pa legs par spyad pa las khyad par du byed pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúmerely‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe other abstentions are merely good conduct‚Äù distinguishes good conduct from vows.

original: 'di yang 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba 'dren par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di yang 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba 'dren par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Good conduct also leads to pleasant results.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyas par ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyas par ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the request‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the extensive request.‚Äù

original: gar dang glu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni rol mo dang spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pa dang kha dog bsdu'o //
analyzed: gar dang glu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni rol mo dang spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pa dang kha dog bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdance, song, etc.‚Äù includes music, perfume, garlands, ointments, and cosmetics.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni dus za ba'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni dus za ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Without these‚Äù means without the time for eating.

original: gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba ni bsnyen gnas dang skyo ba'i dran pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba ni bsnyen gnas dang skyo ba'i dran pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Without both‚Äù means without the fast and the recollection of disgust.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyis dus su za ba'i khyim pa rnams kyi skyo ba 'dren par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyis dus su za ba'i khyim pa rnams kyi skyo ba 'dren par byed pa yin no //
translated: The fast is prescribed for householders, but the recollection of disgust is prescribed for those who have gone forth, since it induces disgust with eating at improper times.

original: gnyis su bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis su bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: ‚Äú It should be divided into two.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gnyis su byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyis su byed ce na /
translated: Why should it be divided into two?

original: gzhan du na ni gso ba yan lag bdun du 'gyur gyi yan lag brgyad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni gso ba yan lag bdun du 'gyur gyi yan lag brgyad du ni ma yin no //

original: dper na yang dag pa'i lta ba lam yang yin la lam gyi yan lag kyang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir rtsva'i rtse mos 'thung ba bkag pa yin te ;

analyzed: ma smos pa'i rgyu bshad pa ni de dag ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The Blessed One said in a s≈´tra, ‚ÄúThrough the occasion of heedlessness, which is liquor, wine, and other intoxicants that cause heedlessness, that are the basis of heedlessness, through frequenting, cultivating, and practicing that occasion, after the breakup of the body, one is born in the hells.

analyzed: chang ni de spang ba'i sdom pa can la sbyin par mi bya ste bag med pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang las gcig 'thob pa zhes bya ba la /

translated: The pratimoksa vows are obtained from Dharma objects that generate concepts.üîΩ

original: 'dir thams cad du las kyi lam gyi gzhi la las kyi sgra 'jug pa snga ma'i bzhi pa yang @43b dka' ba ma yin snyam du sems se //

analyzed: de ltar byas na da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa'i las kyi lam dag sdom par mi rung la /
