analyzed: sdom par nus pas ma 'ongs pa 'dod pa'i las kyi lam 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible to vow to abandon future karma, it is logical that the karmic path is future karma.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ma yin zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ma yin zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The past and future are not vows.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa las gzhan pa rnam pa gsum gzung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa las gzhan pa rnam pa gsum gzung ngo //
translated: The three types of vows other than that are posited as vows.

original: de la rnam pa gsum yang lus kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi sgo nas brdzun du smra ba spong ba kho na yan lag tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum yang lus kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi sgo nas brdzun du smra ba spong ba kho na yan lag tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The three types of vows are posited as the three branches of abandoning taking life and so on through the body and abandoning lying through the speech.

original: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa ni dge ba'i sems thams cad la lhan cig 'byung la sems chung du dang 'bring dang / chen po dag ni rnam grangs kyis 'byung gi cig car ma yin pas /
analyzed: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa ni dge ba'i sems thams cad la lhan cig 'byung la sems chung du dang 'bring dang / chen po dag ni rnam grangs kyis 'byung gi cig car ma yin pas /
translated: Small, medium, and great minds occur in order, not simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir rgyu las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúAlso, from the cause.‚Äù

original: sdom pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad la dbang du bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad la dbang du bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in vows‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúhaving control over all.‚Äù

original: yan lag thams cad kyis ma yin pa ni bsnyen gnas dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge tshul gyi sdom pa dag la phra ma dang tshig rtsub po dang kyal pa spong ba rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad kyis ma yin pa ni bsnyen gnas dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge tshul gyi sdom pa dag la phra ma dang tshig rtsub po dang kyal pa spong ba rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot by all branches‚Äù refers to the vows of one-day fasting, lay practitioner, and novice monk, because the avoidance of slander, harsh words, and idle speech is impossible.

original: rgyu thams cad kyis ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsems chung ngu la sogs pa rnams las sems gang yang rung ba zhig gis dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu thams cad kyis ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni / sems chung ngu la sogs pa rnams las sems gang yang rung ba zhig gis dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúNot by all causes‚Äù refers toüîΩthe vows of lay practitioner,üîΩone-day fasting, and novice monk,

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa'am /
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa'am /
translated: because they are obtained by any of the small, medium, or great minds.

original: dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: It is the perfect taking up of the novice vows.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is in accord with all sentient beings, since it focuses on all sentient beings.

original: sems can dge ba ni gnod pa med pa'i sems sam phan 'dogs pa'i sems te /
analyzed: sems can dge ba ni gnod pa med pa'i sems sam phan 'dogs pa'i sems te /
translated: Sentient beings are virtuous when they have a nonviolent mind or a helpful mind.

original: log par ma zhugs pa'i phyir dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log par ma zhugs pa'i phyir dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called virtuous because they do not engage in evil.

original: sdig pa'i bsam pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdig pa'i bsam pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are not free from the intention to commit evil.

original: gnod pa'i bsam pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bsam pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not free from the intention to harm.

original: ji ltar mi nus pa dag las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung @44a * //
analyzed: ji ltar mi nus pa dag las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung @44a * //
translated: How is it impossible in relation to those who are incapable?

original: ste ; gang zhig gang dag gi srog dang longs spyod dang chung ma 'phrog par mi nus pa de la de dag gi yul can srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi srid pas de dag las srog gcod pa spong ba'i bdag nyid kyi sdom pa mi rung ngo snyam du
analyzed: ste ; gang zhig gang dag gi srog dang longs spyod dang chung ma 'phrog par mi nus pa de la de dag gi yul can srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi srid pas de dag las srog gcod pa spong ba'i bdag nyid kyi sdom pa mi rung ngo snyam du
translated: Those who are incapable of stealing the life, possessions, or wife of others cannot be the object of the karma of killing and so on. Therefore it is impossible to abandon taking life in relation to them.

original: sems so // sems can thams cad kyi srog la mi gnod pa'i bsam pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems so // sems can thams cad kyi srog la mi gnod pa'i bsam pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because one promises with the thought of not harming the life of any sentient being.

original: sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa'i bsam pa khyad par med pa'i phyir nus pa dag bzhin mi nus pa dag las kyang 'thob po /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mi gnod pa'i bsam pa khyad par med pa'i phyir nus pa dag bzhin mi nus pa dag las kyang 'thob po /
translated: One obtains it from those who are not able to do so, as well as from those who are able, because there is no distinction in the thought of not harming any sentient being.

original: de lta ma yin na gnyid log pa dang myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa rnams kyis thams cad du mi nus pa'i phyir sdom pa gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gnyid log pa dang myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa rnams kyis thams cad du mi nus pa'i phyir sdom pa gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would lose the vow when asleep, intoxicated, or unconscious, because one would not be able to do so in all cases.üîΩIs it the case that one can harm those who obtain it in dependence on ideation?

original: ci 'du shes la rag las te 'thob pas de la gnod par nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ni nus pa rnams 'thob pa'i nus pa bzhin du mi nus pa rnams la yang ste /
analyzed: ci 'du shes la rag las te 'thob pas de la gnod par nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ni nus pa rnams 'thob pa'i nus pa bzhin du mi nus pa rnams la yang ste /
translated: Those who are able to do so obtain it, as well as those who are not able to do so.

original: 'di mtshungs par 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di mtshungs par 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is similar to the increase and decrease of the power to obtain it.

original: lha la sogs pa mi nus pa rnams mi rnams la sogs pa nus pa dag gi nang du 'pho bas 'phel ba dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa mi nus pa rnams mi rnams la sogs pa nus pa dag gi nang du 'pho bas 'phel ba dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The gods and so on, who are not capable, are transferred to the capable humans and so on, and thus they increase,

original: sngon med par sdom pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon med par sdom pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they obtain the vow that did not exist before.

original: mi la sogs pa nus pa rnams la sogs pa mi nus pa dag gi nang du 'pho bas 'grib pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa nus pa rnams la sogs pa mi nus pa dag gi nang du 'pho bas 'grib pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The capable humans and so on are transferred to the incapable gods and so on, and thus they decrease,üîΩbecause they are separated from the vow that was obtained before.

original: sngar thob pa'i sdom pa dang bral ba'i de ltar na 'thob pa'i rgyu gzhan gyi rnam par rig par byed pa la sogs pa dag dang / gtong ba'i rgyu bslab pa 'bul ba la sogs pa dag med par yang sdom pa 'thob pa dang gtong ba 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar thob pa'i sdom pa dang bral ba'i de ltar na 'thob pa'i rgyu gzhan gyi rnam par rig par byed pa la sogs pa dag dang / gtong ba'i rgyu bslab pa 'bul ba la sogs pa dag med par yang sdom pa 'thob pa dang gtong ba 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even without the causes of obtaining the vow, such as the other‚Äôs consciousness of the request and so on, and the causes of relinquishing the vow, such as offering back the training and so on, the vow is obtained and relinquished.

original: sems can rnams ni sngon yang yod la phyis kyang yod pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni sngon yang yod la phyis kyang yod pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because sentient beings existed in the past and will exist in the future,

original: ji ltar khyad par 'di lta bu gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems so //
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par 'di lta bu gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems so //
translated: one thinks that such a distinction will occur.

original: de la 'di chos mi mthun pa tsam gyis gnas skabs ma yin par nus pa med do //
analyzed: de la 'di chos mi mthun pa tsam gyis gnas skabs ma yin par nus pa med do //
translated: It is not the case that the vows are not possible because they are dissimilar to those things.üîΩIf you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they did not exist previously, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they did not exist previously.üîΩIf you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they do not exist later, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they do not exist later.

original: ci ste rtsva la sogs pa la sngon med pa'i phyir phyis kyang sdom pa med pa nyid du 'dod pa de lta na 'dir yang sdom pa 'grib pa dang 'phel ba'i tshul gyis sam rtsva la sogs pa rnams thams cad las sdom pa de ltar thal bar 'gyurüîΩro // @44b ci ltar sdom pa 'grib par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /üîΩyul med pa'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste rtsva la sogs pa la sngon med pa'i phyir phyis kyang sdom pa med pa nyid du 'dod pa de lta na 'dir yang sdom pa 'grib pa dang 'phel ba'i tshul gyis sam rtsva la sogs pa rnams thams cad las sdom pa de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro // @44b ci ltar sdom pa 'grib par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni / yul med pa'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they do not exist in the present, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they do not exist in the present.üîΩIf you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained.

original: gal te yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas sdom pa med na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas sdom pa med na /
translated: If you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained by all, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained by all.üîΩIf you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained by sentient beings, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained by sentient beings.

original: de lta na 'o na zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /üîΩ'di la slob dpon gyis lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes rgya cher 'byung ste / 'di la slob dpon gyis lan gsungs pa /
translated: If you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained by sentient beings, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained by sentient beings.üîΩIf you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained by sentient beings, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained by sentient beings.üîΩIf you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained by sentient beings, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained by sentient beings.üîΩIf you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained by sentient beings, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained by sentient beings.

original: thams cad kyis sems can thams cad las thob pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thams cad kyis sems can thams cad las thob pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If you assert that the vows do not exist in grass and so on because they are not obtained by sentient beings, then it follows that the vows do not exist in all sentient beings because they are not obtained by sentient beings.

original: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: If you

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyu dang grog spur gyi rgyud las kyang srog gcod pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyu dang grog spur gyi rgyud las kyang srog gcod pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Also, the cause of a buddha and the continuum of an ant are both causes for abandoning taking life.

original: ci khyad par yod dam 'on te cung zad kyang med /
analyzed: ci khyad par yod dam 'on te cung zad kyang med /
translated: Is there a difference or is there not even the slightest difference?

original: gal te yod na 'gro ba ma nges pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi sdom pa 'phel pa dang 'gribs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na 'gro ba ma nges pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi sdom pa 'phel pa dang 'gribs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is, then because the state of being a sentient being is not definite, it would follow that the vows of sentient beings would increase and decrease.

original: ci ste med na ci ltar mi bsad pa las phas pham pa dang / mi ma yin pa bsad pa las sbom po dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa bsad pa las ltung byed du 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste med na ci ltar mi bsad pa las phas pham pa dang / mi ma yin pa bsad pa las sbom po dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa bsad pa las ltung byed du 'gyur /
translated: But if there is no difference, then how is it that killing a human is a defeating offense, killing a nonhuman is a serious transgression and killing an animal is a downfall?

original: de'i phyir rgyud kyi sgo nas sdom ba la khyad par med do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud kyi sgo nas sdom ba la khyad par med do snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference in vows from the perspective of the continuum.

original: chad pa'i las kyi khyad par las ni sbyor ba'i khyad par las so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chad pa'i las kyi khyad par las ni sbyor ba'i khyad par las so zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the difference in the karmic action of killing is due to the difference in preparation.

original: gzhan dag ni mi la kun tu sbyor ba gzhan ni ji srid grog sbur la mtshungs pa de srid 'gor ba mtshungs pa la skye ba sbyor ba'i sgo nas las rnams kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mi la kun tu sbyor ba gzhan ni ji srid grog sbur la mtshungs pa de srid 'gor ba mtshungs pa la skye ba sbyor ba'i sgo nas las rnams kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: The difference in karma is due to the difference in the connection of the action with the life of the agent.

original: ji ltar glang po che bsad pa ni bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang la grog sbur ni ches nyung na mtshungs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: ji ltar glang po che bsad pa ni bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang la grog sbur ni ches nyung na mtshungs pa lta ci smos /
translated: For example, killing an elephant is a greater nonvirtuous action than killing an ant, and the difference is due to the life of the agent.

original: sdom pa ni bsam pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ni bsam pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Vows are established by motivation.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i dge ba'i bsam pas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i dge ba'i bsam pas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are established by the virtuous intention that extends to all sentient beings.

original: de ni de las thob po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni de las thob po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One obtains it from that.

original: rang gi rgyud las las kyi lam dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i sdom pa'i thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las las kyi lam dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i sdom pa'i thob pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not obtain vows subsumed by the actual basis of the karmic path from one's own mindstream.

original: sems dang chos la sogs pa ma gyur par rang gsad pa las mtshams med pa la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang chos la sogs pa ma gyur par rang gsad pa las mtshams med pa la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One obtains heinous acts such as matricide and so on from killing one's mother and so forth when they are not transformed into something else such as a mind of enlightenment.

original: nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i ni mi 'gog ste /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i ni mi 'gog ste /
translated: One does not obtain them from the access state to the actual basis.

original: khu ba 'byin pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba 'byin pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the avoidance of emission of semen, etc.

original: sdom pa min pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sdom pa ma yin pa ni las kyi lam thams cad kyi sgor gyur pa nyes par spyod pa la bya ste /üîΩgang gi tshe sdom pa ma yin pa thob nas bsams bzhin du srog chags kyi srog @45a * //
analyzed: sdom pa min pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sdom pa ma yin pa ni las kyi lam thams cad kyi sgor gyur pa nyes par spyod pa la bya ste / gang gi tshe sdom pa ma yin pa thob nas bsams bzhin du srog chags kyi srog @45a * //
translated: All non-restraints: non-restraint is a form of misconduct that is the gateway to all the karmic paths.

original: gcod par byed pa de ni de'i las kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: gcod par byed pa de ni de'i las kyi lam yin no //
translated: When one obtains non-restraint, if one intentionally takes the life of a living being, that is the karmic path of killing.

original: rgyas par thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be extended to all the karmic paths.

original: sems zhan pa la sogs pa cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems zhan pa la sogs pa cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Because weak minds, etc., do not occur simultaneously.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag lhan cig mi 'byung bas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang cig car mi 'byung bas ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag lhan cig mi 'byung bas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang cig car mi 'byung bas ma yin nam /
translated: If non-virtuous roots do not occur simultaneously because attachment and aversion do not occur simultaneously,

original: ci'i phyir sems zhan pa la sogs pa kho na brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems zhan pa la sogs pa kho na brjod ce na /
translated: why are only weak minds, etc., mentioned?

original: rnam grangs tha ma nges pa la brten te brjod pas skyon med do //
analyzed: rnam grangs tha ma nges pa la brten te brjod pas skyon med do //
translated: There is no error, because they are mentioned based on the final enumeration.

original: de ltar thams cad kyi sdom pa ma yin pa'i rgyu gcig nyid la shen pa dang bya gag gsod pa dang phag gsod pa zhes par 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad kyi sdom pa ma yin pa'i rgyu gcig nyid la shen pa dang bya gag gsod pa dang phag gsod pa zhes par 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
translated: Why is the single cause of all of them called a butcher, a poultry butcher, or a pig butcher?

original: sdom pa bzhin du thob pas 'dis sngon med pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sdom pa bzhin du thob pas 'dis sngon med pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob pa ma yin la /
translated: Just as with the vows, one does not obtain a new nonvirtuous vow through this.

original: srog gcod pa'i rnam par rig byed gang yin pa de ni 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i rnam par rig byed gang yin pa de ni 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: But the indicative form of the action of taking life does occur.

original: 'dis sngar nyid du sems can thams cad lam bsdams te /
analyzed: 'dis sngar nyid du sems can thams cad lam bsdams te /
translated: This is because one has already taken a vow not to harm the life of any sentient being.

original: de'i srog la gnod par khas blang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i srog la gnod par khas blang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One has accepted not to harm their life.

original: de ni sngon med pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa thob pa gang las she na /
analyzed: de ni sngon med pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa thob pa gang las she na /
translated: From what is the obtainment of a new nonvirtuous vow?

original: dge bsnyen gyis ni dge tshul gyi sdom pa'i sngon dang / dge tshul gyi yang dge slong gi sdom pa'i sngon du skye'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyis ni dge tshul gyi sdom pa'i sngon dang / dge tshul gyi yang dge slong gi sdom pa'i sngon du skye'o //
translated: The lay practitioner obtains it prior to the vows of the novice and the novice obtains it prior to the vows of a monk.

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i lam de'i 'khor gyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i lam de'i 'khor gyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It arises from the special retinue of the path of taking up virtue.

original: chen po ni srog gcod pa'i rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: chen po ni srog gcod pa'i rnam par rig byed do //
translated: The great is the indicative form of killing.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang rtog par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang rtog par bya'o //
translated: Nonindicative form should be understood in the same way.

original: glang po che 'chor pa na ni ba glang 'chor ba rnams so //
analyzed: glang po che 'chor pa na ni ba glang 'chor ba rnams so //
translated: When elephants are stolen, oxen are stolen.üîΩOr ministers are those who rule according to the Dharma.

original: blon po ni chos bzhin 'don pa dag go / yang na blon po ni bka' pa gtogs pa'o / don gyis na zhes bya ba ni de las mi 'byung yang 'jug pa mthun pa'i phyir sdom pa ma yin pa can du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: blon po ni chos bzhin 'don pa dag go / yang na blon po ni bka' pa gtogs pa'o / don gyis na zhes bya ba ni de las mi 'byung yang 'jug pa mthun pa'i phyir sdom pa ma yin pa can du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that even though it does not occur in that text, it should be understood that one who possesses negative commitments is similar to one who possesses vows because they are similar in terms of engagement.

original: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Abiding in that means

original: de dag ni sdom pa ma yin pa ni yod pa ma yin te 'o na zhe na de la gnas pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni sdom pa ma yin pa ni yod pa ma yin te 'o na zhe na de la gnas pas so //
translated: even though negative commitments do not exist, one who possesses negative commitments is understood because they are similar in terms of engagement.

original: shes na ni zhes bya ba shes bzhin du'o //
analyzed: shes na ni zhes bya ba shes bzhin du'o //
translated: If one knows means if one is aware.

original: 'phags par gyur pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags par gyur pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Even those who have become ƒÅryas means

original: bden ma mthong ba ngan song du skye ba med ces bya'o //
analyzed: bden ma mthong ba ngan song du skye ba med ces bya'o //
translated: it is said that those who have not seen the truth do not take rebirth in lower rebirths.

original: bur gyur pa'i lug rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bur gyur pa'i lug rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Even sheep who have become sons means

original: 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang gis lan smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang gis lan smras pa /
translated: Master Samghabhadra responds to this as follows:

original: dper na @45b shen pa 'ga' zhig gzhan gyi nor ma byin par rang gir mi byed cing /
analyzed: dper na @45b shen pa 'ga' zhig gzhan gyi nor ma byin par rang gir mi byed cing /
translated: For example, a certain brahmin did not take the wealth of others as his own without being given,

original: rang gi chung mas chog shes pa yang bsam pa log par zhugs pa'i phyir yan lag thams cad la sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob po //
analyzed: rang gi chung mas chog shes pa yang bsam pa log par zhugs pa'i phyir yan lag thams cad la sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob po //
translated: and was also content with his own wife. But because his thoughts were perverted, he obtained the non-restraint with respect to all limbs.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang 'gyur te /
translated: So too, it would be for all sentient beings.

original: bsam pa log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩa'a tra tsa britti k'i re nee ba da nta mutta mi ti n'a tr'a da ra kri ya te /
analyzed: bsam pa log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro // a'a tra tsa britti k'i re nee ba da nta mutta mi ti n'a tr'a da ra kri ya te /
translated: Because his thoughts were perverted.üîΩAs it is said in the Atreyashiti:

original: sdom pa ma yin pa ma tshang ba dang nyi tshe ba ni rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa ma tshang ba dang nyi tshe ba ni rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-restraint is not incomplete or partial in any way.‚Äù

original: las kyi lam gyi yan lag mtshang ba'i phyir ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi lam gyi yan lag mtshang ba'i phyir ma tshang ba'o //
translated: It is incomplete because the limbs of the karmic path are incomplete.

original: nyi tshe ba ni sems can dang yul dang dus dang tshe nges pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba ni sems can dang yul dang dus dang tshe nges pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is partial because it is associated with a definite sentient being, object, time, and occasion.

original: rnam pa brgyad ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for the eight types.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa rnam pa brgyad ma gtogs pa gzhan ni nyi tshe ba dang mtshang ba yang yod do //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa rnam pa brgyad ma gtogs pa gzhan ni nyi tshe ba dang mtshang ba yang yod do //
translated: Other than the eight types of pratimoksa vows, there are also limited and flawed ethics.

original: tshul khrims dang 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims de tsam gyis gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid la smras pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims de tsam gyis gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid la smras pa /
translated: Because ethics and the morality of restraint are merely that, they are an obstruction.

original: de lta na sdom pa min can gyi dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen sdom min can zhes bya ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na sdom pa min can gyi dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen sdom min can zhes bya ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that a layperson would possess negative commitments and a person with negative commitments would be a layperson.

original: 'di ni mdo sde ba la gnod byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde ba la gnod byed de /
translated: This is a refutation of the Sautrantikas,

original: de dag ni skyabs su 'gro bo tsam las sdom pa med par yang de dge bsnyen no zhes so //
analyzed: de dag ni skyabs su 'gro bo tsam las sdom pa med par yang de dge bsnyen no zhes so //
translated: because they say that a layperson is merely one who goes for refuge and does not possess vows.

original: da ni gang la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa dang de la 'jug par byed /
analyzed: da ni gang la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa dang de la 'jug par byed /
translated: Now, who is it that turns away from taking life and so on and engages in it?

original: de ni gal te bsdams pa dang ma bsdams ba las yin te /
analyzed: de ni gal te bsdams pa dang ma bsdams ba las yin te /
translated: That is due to restraint and nonrestraint.

original: 'di la ci zhig gnod /
analyzed: 'di la ci zhig gnod /
translated: What is the harm in that?

original: de'i rigs su skyes pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni shen pa la sogs pa sdom pa ma yin pa can gyi rigs su skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i rigs su skyes pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni shen pa la sogs pa sdom pa ma yin pa can gyi rigs su skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Those born in such a family means those born in a family of non-vows such as a butcher.üîΩOne obtains vows through the field, through the rite, and through respect.

original: zhing dang len pa dang gus par byed pas 'thob ces bya ba la byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhing dang len pa dang gus par byed pas 'thob ces bya ba la byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthrough‚Äù is to be construed with each of the three terms.

original: zhing byed pa dang / len par byed pa dang / gus par byed pa ni zhing dang len pa dang gus par byed pa 'o //
analyzed: zhing byed pa dang / len par byed pa dang / gus par byed pa ni zhing dang len pa dang gus par byed pa 'o //
translated: The field is the one through whom one obtains vows, the rite is the one who makes one obtain vows, and respect is the one who makes one obtain vows.

original: yang 'dir len pa nying byed pa'o zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //üîΩbyed pa ni g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: yang 'dir len pa nying byed pa'o zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o // byed pa ni g-yo ba ste /
translated: Here the compound is resolved as follows: the one who makes one obtain vows is the field.üîΩThe rite is the one who makes one obtain vows.

original: byed pa ni g-yo ba la'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byed pa ni g-yo ba la'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Respect is the one who makes one obtain vows.

original: mi brda phrad pa 'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi brda phrad pa 'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One who does not understand language means one who does not understand the words of the rite.

original: mi brda phrad pa ni 'dir gang zhig 'dis bslab pa phul lo snyam du de'i tshig shes pa de la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: mi brda phrad pa ni 'dir gang zhig 'dis bslab pa phul lo snyam du de'i tshig shes pa de la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: One who does not understand language is asserted here to be one who does not understand the words of the rite, thinking, ‚ÄúI will offer the training.‚Äù

original: bsam pa thag pa ni sdom pa don du mi gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa ni sdom pa don du mi gnyer ba'o //
translated: One who does not have the intention means one who does not seek vows.

original: de dang 'gal @46a * //
analyzed: de dang 'gal @46a * //
translated: One who is in opposition to that is one who seeks vows.

original: ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi khyad par ni bslab pa phul ba ste sems bskyed pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi khyad par ni bslab pa phul ba ste sems bskyed pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The specific form of indicative rejection is the offering of the training, not the mere generation of the mind.

original: de thob pa bzhin du bslab pa 'bul ba'i sems kyang nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pa bzhin du bslab pa 'bul ba'i sems kyang nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind that offers the training is not as powerful as the mind that obtains the vow.

original: rmi lam gyi nang du btang ba las rnam par rig byed tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du btang ba las rnam par rig byed tsam ma yin no //
translated: The offering of the training is not merely the indicative form of rejection in a dream.

original: khro ba dang myos pa la sogs pas kyang phyir phul ba ma yin pas gnyi ga ma yin pa tsam mo //
analyzed: khro ba dang myos pa la sogs pas kyang phyir phul ba ma yin pas gnyi ga ma yin pa tsam mo //
translated: It is not the offering of the training through anger, intoxication and so on.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa la sogs pa'i mdun du bslab pa phul ba med do //üîΩrten nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa 'am /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa la sogs pa'i mdun du bslab pa phul ba med do // rten nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa 'am /
translated: The offering of the training is not in the presence of those born as animals and so on.

original: bud med kyi rten ji lta bu sdom pa blangs pa de lta bus de nyams pa ste /
analyzed: bud med kyi rten ji lta bu sdom pa blangs pa de lta bus de nyams pa ste /
translated: The degeneration of the basis refers to the degeneration of the basis of the male or female form in which the vow was taken.

original: 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third cause of relinquishment.

original: gzhi chad pa dang zhes bya ba la sdom pa'i gzhi ste rgyu ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum yin la /
analyzed: gzhi chad pa dang zhes bya ba la sdom pa'i gzhi ste rgyu ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum yin la /
translated: The severance of the basis refers to the severance of the basis or cause of the vow, which is the three roots of virtue.

original: de dag chad pas sdom pa yang 'chad de /
analyzed: de dag chad pas sdom pa yang 'chad de /
translated: And if they are severed, the vows are also severed.

original: 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth cause of relinquishment.

original: nyin zhag tu 'phangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyin zhag tu 'phangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the vows are measured by the day,

original: 'di gtong ba'i rgyu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gtong ba'i rgyu lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth cause of relinquishment.

original: kha cig ltung bar gyur las smra zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa pham pa las te /
analyzed: kha cig ltung bar gyur las smra zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa pham pa las te /
translated: Some say: from the downfall of a defeat, such as sexual intercourse.

original: 'di ltung bar byed pas na ltung bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltung bar byed pas na ltung bar gyur ba'o //
translated: Since it causes one to fall, it is a downfall.

original: kha che rnams ni byung ba la /
analyzed: kha che rnams ni byung ba la /
translated: Kashmiri masters say:

original: bu lon nor bzhin gnyis su 'dod /
analyzed: bu lon nor bzhin gnyis su 'dod /
translated: Like debt and wealth, they are both.

original: ces bya ba la bu lon dang nor ni bu lon nor te ;
analyzed: ces bya ba la bu lon dang nor ni bu lon nor te ;
translated: Debt and wealth are debt and wealth.

original: de dag dang 'dra ba ni bu lon nor bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag dang 'dra ba ni bu lon nor bzhin no //
translated: They are like that, like debt and wealth.

original: yang ci'i phyir de rnams de ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de rnams de ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: Why do they assert them in that way?

original: de'i phyir phyogs gcig nyams pas sdom pa zad par gtong ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gcig nyams pas sdom pa zad par gtong ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is illogical that the vows are relinquished through the degeneration of one part.

original: ltung ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba'o //
translated: Another downfall means a downfall of a partially concordant defeat.

original: rten nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Degeneration of the basis means

original: mtshan gnyis cig car byung ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis cig car byung ba ste /
translated: and the two organs arise simultaneously.

original: ji ltar rang gi rten las sdom pa skye ba'i rjes su 'jug pa de nyams pas ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du rjes su mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi rten las sdom pa skye ba'i rjes su 'jug pa de nyams pas ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du rjes su mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: Just as the vows arise in dependence on the basis, so they do not arise when the basis is impaired.

original: lus rnam par 'gyur ba la sems rnam par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir dang bdag po yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnam par 'gyur ba la sems rnam par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir dang bdag po yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: The third cause of relinquishing vows is the transformation of the body, because it is possible that the mind transforms with the transformation of the body and because the body is the dominant condition of the vows.

original: gzhi chad pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi chad pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fourth cause of relinquishing vows is the termination of the basis.

original: sdom pa'i gzhi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin kun slong gi sems chad pa las sdom pa yang chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdom pa'i gzhi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin kun slong gi sems chad pa las sdom pa yang chad par 'gyur te /
translated: The vows are terminated when the basis of the vows, either indicative or nonindicative form, is terminated.

original: des na 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gtong ba'i rgyu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Therefore this is the fourth cause of relinquishing vows.
